os-availability-zone API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

We need to default the GET /os-availability-zone policy same as
GET details /os-availability-zone which is admin otherwise it is
open to everyone.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policies/attach_interfaces.py#L28
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/api/openstack/compute/availability_zone.py#L111
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

commit_message:
Correct os-availability-zone policy check_str

os-availability-zone API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

AZ is user facing thing so that any user can list the AZ and use the
same for creating server. Code is behaving as expected but policy
rule check_str is confusing so let's correct it to base.RULE_ANY.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policies/attach_interfaces.py#L28
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/api/openstack/compute/availability_zone.py#L111
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Closes-bug: #1862484

Change-Id: If599a984a33081a93514b1a2ea02c0d5b850da8e

commit_message:
[gnocchi] Disable statsd daemon by default

This daemon is an additional piece of functionality supported by Gnocchi
and the general pattern in KA is to disable such things unless the user
explicitly wants them. This also helps avoid having to set the
resource_id, user_id, and project_id variables for Gnocchi if you don't
care about this daemon.

Change-Id: I5f14cee4b0bb0d781b1ff53200d11de972d20c82

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-08 23:31:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing availability-zone policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh [1], to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing availability-zone policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#testing

Change-Id: I313a22419756af43561118d401087b92b62df644

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing availability-zone policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh [1], to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing availability-zone policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#testing

Change-Id: I313a22419756af43561118d401087b92b62df644

commit_message:
[CentOS-8] Install ansible 2.8

Currently ceph-ansible is dependent on Ansible-2.8. In order to
unblock the work, install it explicitly in CI.

Change-Id: I88b83da5d4e18dfb4ee7933b5ed05311283627b1
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Always update router static route

- This change fixed an issue where the update_router_routes method
would not execute when all static routes were removed

Closes-Bug: #1860273

Change-Id: I33559947f63ab4259ec99f093350e8e6eeb83d7d
Signed-off-by: zhangyuhe <1073258077@qq.com>

[{'account_id': 31210, 'date': '2019-12-12 06:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-12-12 06:38:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Create a reserved port as DHCP service IP for subnet without gateway IP,
when meatadata service is disable

Currently, OVN does not support DHCP for subnet without gateway IP
when meatadata service is disable.

Change-Id: Iab03c3300a1603e42c16dbcc36035363c8704340
Signed-off-by: zhangyuhe <1073258077@qq.com>
Closes-Bug: #1670666

commit_message:
Fix W504 and remove exclusion

This is a topic where there are two points of view. While neither
is fundamentally better than the other in reality, what's best is
to not have any arguments about it. The tox.ini comments about 503
and 504 that were in place make the argument that:

  - 503 is intended to be disabled and 504 enabled by default
  - Donald Knuth believes 504 is the right way

Since Donald Knuth is smarter than all of us, align with 504, match
the comments in the file and turn on enforcement to keep it that way.

Change-Id: I92d4d1e82935e30ae42a0e14e641cbe36fd6e811

commit_message:
Remove F403 and F405 exclusions

Importing from * is not a thing that should be done, as it masks
errors and makes code hard to understand. There are some copy-pasta
files that violate this. Mark them with noqa for now, because we don't
actually care about them.

Change-Id: I790f88c75ea546d83e347e42df0050ad36211936

commit_message:
Remove old artifacts when building new ones

For local dev, multiple iterations can wind up with multiple
files in the build_artifact dir. Remove them when building so
that the ls command works.

Change-Id: Id309c34679d2c0b6d9380665a381af4b52495d19

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2020-02-18 23:46:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Hey Rachit, thanks for the patch!  This fixes a pretty insidious bug.  I didn't have time to review the test cases today, but I will do that tomorrow.  Please see my comments in the code.  I've tried to help clarifying some of the text as Julia requested.

For clarity to other reviewers, I thought I would try to describe in detail here the flow that causes the bug to occur in the original code.  Rachit, please correct me if I've gotten this wrong!

Here's the flow when the error occurs:
1. User executes RAID volume creation cleaning step, creating a virtual disk on RAID controller that supports passthru mode
2. We first invoke the operation to convert the needed drives to JBOD mode.  The code adds the job id to raid_config_job_ids on the node.
3. The code then actively waits for the job to complete by polling the iDRAC periodically
4. At this point, we have 2 threads looking for the job to finish: the actively polling thread and the _query_raid_config_job_status() periodic job.
5. The _query_raid_config_job_status() periodic job wakes up and sees that the job completed.
6. Because there's no substep, it notifies the conductor that the cleaning step is finished, and the conductor moves to the next cleaning step, or otherwise allows other operations against the server.
7. The actively polling thread from step 3 wakes up and sees that the job finished
8. This thread then creates the config job to create the virtual disk
9. But at this point, we've already told the conductor that the cleaning step is finished and to resume cleaning
10. If a user then takes another action against the same server that requires creating a config job, then that action fails because the job to create the virtual disk is still running."}, {'account_id': 29405, 'date': '2020-02-20 09:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2020-02-20 11:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(6 comments)

Hey Guys,
Thanks a lot for the review comments. I have addressed all the review comments

Thanks Chris for detailed and clean clarification. Yes above explanation is what this change is about. 
I just want to add some more points as an enhancements after point 3 above with the reference to the points explained by Chris:

- After actively wait for the job(for drives conversion at line [1]) to complete by polling the iDRAC periodically, JOB_ID will be saved in ``raid_config_job_ids`` on the node 
  properties (and that job status will mark as completed i.e., job_status='Completed') But after that immediately there 
  will be another configuration job created to create the virtual disk at line:[2]

- After at point 5 above _query_raid_config_job_status() periodic job wakes up and sees that the job to create virtual disk is completed OR NOT.
  So at this point(on line:[3]) our scenario will be as follows:
  ``raid_config_jobs_ids`` will have two job ids: 
   1. One configuration job invoked(at line [4]) for drives conversion from JBOD to RAID will have job_status='completed'
   2. Second configuration job to create virtual disks which will be running or half completed.
   For e.g : raid_config_jobs_ids = [JID_740752388763(status='Completed'), JID_740752388764(status='Running')]

- But at line[5]
  There is a condition which checks the configuration job is completed or not. and if it is completed then it will append that particular job_id to ``finished_jobs_ids`` at 
  line:[6]. In this case, configuration job for drives conversion is completed and its job id will be append to ``finished_jobs_ids`` which will NOT satisfies the condition. And as per the procedure it will proceed further to find and execute next cleaning step/substep or to resume cleaning.

- Now after configuration job to create virtual disks is started we've already told the conductor that this was the last cleaning step and to resume cleaning. 

- So at last scenario will be like: node will be in cleaning state but the configuration job to create_virtual_disks will be still running.

- And at last point(10) above Chris said :  ''If a user then takes another action against the same server that requires creating a config job, then that action fails because the job to create the virtual disk is still running''

Hope this makes sense. Let me know if more explanation needed.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/drac/raid.py#L1060
[2]https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/drac/raid.py#L1070
[3]https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/drac/raid.py#L1176

commit_message:
DRAC: Fix RAID create_config clean step

This patch fixes this issue by only allowing
the cleaning step to finish after the job to
create the virtual disk completes.

Change-Id: I7879e0534018f9a2ad12155fd886b069604bf3d3
Story: 2007285
Task: 38738

commit_message:
[XtremIO] Remove provisioning factor when reporting

'free_capacity_gb' is incorrectly reported cause the real
size has been multiplied by max_over_subscription_ratio

Change-Id: I9804b580f90ecfca764a205c46a02ca73d32adcc
Closes-Bug: #1773725

[{'created': '2020-02-28 17:23:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages override

backport: train, stein, rocky

Override in filter needs to follow the rule:
<image_name>_<call_type>_<override/append/remove>
`call_type` for `kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages` should be
`pip_virtualenv_packages`, and `pip_packages` can't match with
`kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages`, this makes

"}]
commit_message:
Fix kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages override

backport: train, stein, rocky

Override in filter needs to follow the rule:
<image_name>_<call_type>_<override/append/remove>
`call_type` for `kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages` should be
`pip_virtualenv_packages`, and `pip_packages` can't match with
`kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages`, this makes
the value can't be overrode in template override.

Change-Id: I1dbe2dfd4bce73ce2285f45f997d45b5dcc95f4c
Closes-bug: #1865119
(cherry picked from commit 74d5a66e6bf744ad936d702443a8d64be86441ba)

commit_message:
Fix kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages override

backport: train, stein, rocky

Override in filter needs to follow the rule:
<image_name>_<call_type>_<override/append/remove>
`call_type` for `kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages` should be
`pip_virtualenv_packages`, and `pip_packages` can't match with
`kolla_toolbox_pip_virtualenv_packages`, this makes
the value can't be overrode in template override.

Change-Id: I1dbe2dfd4bce73ce2285f45f997d45b5dcc95f4c
Closes-bug: #1865119
(cherry picked from commit 74d5a66e6bf744ad936d702443a8d64be86441ba)

[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-19 21:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-19 22:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Reason: we do not want to have the maintainer label and build date label in our images. At the moment we have to remove them manually. This way it is simply possible by using the template overrides.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-24 15:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-02-24 15:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-02-25 09:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 10:35:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Marc @Radoslaw: Can we merge this? We would need it and I wouldn't like to wait long because of new incoming Dockerfiles."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-25 14:08:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I was sure we had this already, but it seems not.

Here's how I understand the headers and footers to work. Assuming we have 3 images: base -> openstack-base -> my-image

Each of these would have its own pair of headers and footers.

base_header/base_footer
openstack_base_header/openstack_base_footer
my_image_header/my_image_footer

Then the final image in the chain has a footer right at the end. Therefore the 'header' block should go at the start of the base image, and probably be empty like the others.

If you want to make it possible to swap out the labels, I suggest you add a different block, e.g. block labels"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-25 14:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 15:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 15:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Doh. Didn't read the comment correctly. I'm renaming the block to Label."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 15:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from global-header to block-label'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-01 17:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-02 10:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-02 10:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

[{'created': '2020-01-30 13:10:48.000000000', 'message': 'Federated openid support using auth_mod_openidc

This patch adds support for using mod_auth_openidc instead of shibboleth for
supporting users who have a preference to use oidc for federation. A new
variable to called apache_mod is added to keystone_sp allowing the auth library
to be selected. If left undefined shibboleth auth module will continue to be
installed by default maintaining backward compatibility.

This patch does not support simultaneous use of shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc
primarily because shib2 depends on libcurl3 but mod_auth_openidc depends on
libcurl4 which cannot coexist on Ubuntu. This can be resolved when there is a
shib3 package available in a future release of Ubuntu.

commit_message:
Federated openid support using auth_mod_openidc

This patch adds support for using mod_auth_openidc instead of shibboleth for
supporting users who have a preference to use oidc for federation. A new
variable called apache_mod is added to keystone_sp allowing the auth library
to be selected. If left undefined shibboleth auth module will continue to be
installed by default maintaining backward compatibility.

This patch does not support simultaneous use of shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc
primarily because shib2 depends on libcurl3 but mod_auth_openidc depends on
libcurl4 which cannot coexist on Ubuntu. This can be resolved when there is a
shib3 package available in a future release of Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I80031f7d3f0fcc2029cd6861dcb6687e8a9f0a2e

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ic232d0fb24df14cc4d947f6f97eba689a4e9ce89

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: If9549504f67bda1223f55270663ffa00aebdaf4a

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: If9438b0b671933e66d377f0431eded6e2b6478cb

commit_message:
Cleanup docs building

* Remove doc/source/install/conf.py, it's unused.
* Remove settings that are provided by openstackdocstheme from conf.py
  files. Switch to newer openstackdocstheme for this.
* Remove unused deps from tox.ini: releasenotes and api-refonly need
  doc/requirements but not requirements.

Change-Id: Iab5ad6cde40c3342770c0112155fe5e1d262d1e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-08 21:41:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing admin_password policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin role
- policy check fail with context having any other role than admin

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh [1], to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.
When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing admin_password policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#testing

Change-Id: I4a0ae08af91fa7a5c388313440a2d15ae7e6284e

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing admin_password policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin role
- policy check fail with context having any other role than admin

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh [1], to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.
When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing admin_password policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#testing

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I8924a44ca33275e326a48b4cb6db9314d2c7adfd

commit_message:
[DNM] Filter out repos not available or enabled

The repos passed to yum update may not be available,
so just print those and remove from the list of repos
to be used for updating containers.

Change-Id: Idfebc82096b8a0983bf436e39031c9d59db93d96

subject: Fix regex to correctly recognize scientific notation with QemuImgInfo
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-26 16:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nMerged to master and good to get backported.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-02 09:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 11:40:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regex to correctly recognize scientific notation with QemuImgInfo

qemu 4.1.0 output shifts to scientific notation at 1000mb, breaking
oslo.utils.

Problem here is that the qemu-img output shifts to scientific notation:

999 => 999 MiB
1000 => 1e+03 MiB

The regex in python-oslo-utils does not cover this.

This issue is likely regexp parsing "disk size: 1e+03 MiB" value.

These changes fix that.

Change-Id: I4c016865890135023ceb497de18d75ccebd5961a
Closes-Bug: 1864529
(cherry picked from commit ebf8368501500767fd4e6e13602bb88950a4484b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regex to correctly recognize scientific notation with QemuImgInfo

qemu 4.1.0 output shifts to scientific notation at 1000mb, breaking
oslo.utils.

Problem here is that the qemu-img output shifts to scientific notation:

999 => 999 MiB
1000 => 1e+03 MiB

The regex in python-oslo-utils does not cover this.

This issue is likely regexp parsing "disk size: 1e+03 MiB" value.

These changes fix that.

Change-Id: I4c016865890135023ceb497de18d75ccebd5961a
Closes-Bug: 1864529
(cherry picked from commit ebf8368501500767fd4e6e13602bb88950a4484b)

commit_message:
Better policy unit tests

For each policy file we test with a range of context objects to ensure
we accept and reject the correct sets of contexts.

We test the legacy behaviour of user with the admin role having access
to all system scoped admin APIs, and that any authenticated user has
access to the majoriy of admin_or_owner APIs. The protection really
comes from the DB layer.

In a similar way we test that a system scoped admin token, and a project
scoped token with the member role also work as expected.

This test will need to get slowly updated as we fix various policy bugs,
once we have good functional tests in place to validate subtle behaviour
changes, such as 404 if you don't have access to a server so we do not
leak the existence of that server to a user on a different project.

blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic4bc02f3de63b6fe1007d2a8b87723238a41425d

commit_message:
Add ability to change read chunk size

This patch adds the ability to change the read chunk
size during a call to VmdkReadHandle.read calls.
The read size defaults to READ_CHUNKSIZE, which was
the previous behavior.

Change-Id: I2480a2dfc42b51a22a2fce071c62c97d84555cf1

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/708745/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 31m 18s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build SUCCESSFUL (check pipeline).

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered http://52.27.155.124/45/708745/3/check/pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered/c99c007/ : SUCCESS in 22m 03s'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2020-02-20 11:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

On the core idea itself, yes: we should absolutely specify the backing file format whenever we're creating QCOW2 overlays.  Not specifying it is a "CVE waiting to happen" (because of the disk image format probing).

Although the failure from libvirt is informative: 

[...]
libvirt.libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid: format of backing image '/opt/stack/data/nova/instances/_base/8e0569aaf1cbdb522514c3dc9d0fa8fad6f78c50' of image '/opt/stack/data/nova/instances/543723fb-3afc-460c-9139-809bcacd1840/disk' was not specified in the image metadata (See https://libvirt.org/kbase/backing_chains.html for troubleshooting)
[...]

Upstream libvirt is debating on how to fix this with this[1] heavily in-progress patch series.

Regardless, Nova should do the immediately right thing of specifying the backing file format.


[1] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg00616.html -- "[PATCH 0/9] Re-think the stance towards image format probing"'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-02-20 12:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/708745/3 : FAILURE in 1h 56m 29s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1864020'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2020-02-25 06:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-41154 : SUCCESS in 1h 17m 28s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-26 18:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-26 18:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-41253 : SUCCESS in 1h 01m 05s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-02-26 20:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/708745/5 : SUCCESS in 2h 28m 31s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-27 08:35:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Reviewer FYI, while devstack-platform-fedora-latest-virt-preview failed overall here the actual failure within n-cpu [1] isn't the same as the original seen without this change [2].

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/17050123bdb24813ae5cd48118446742/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt?severity=4
[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/4b40ce8fd7524526b4d226afe2848742/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt?severity=4"}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Yes, this is the correct thing to do for Nova, let's get this merged.


Meanwhile, upstream libvirt has settled on an approach in v2[*] of that 
series:

    "Allow format probing to work around lazy clients which did not
    specify their format in the overlay. Format probing will be allowed
    only, if we are able to probe the image, the probing result was
    successful and the probed image does not have any backing or data
    file. [...]"

And an upstream document[+] on "kbase: backing_chains: Add steps how to
securely probe image format".

This is all future goodness, though.


[*] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg01001.html --
    [PATCH v2 2/3] virStorageFileGetMetadataRecurse: Allow format
    probing under special circumstances

[+] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg01103.html'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-27 11:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Looks correct based on the implementation from oslo.utils'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-02-27 13:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-03-02 09:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Make sense.'}]

commit_message:
libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks

Libvirt v6.0.0 [1] will now fail to launch a domain when using qcow2
disks where the backing file format is not recorded in the qcow2
metadata.

There are some discussions upstream around relaxing this slightly [2]
but for now any attempt to launch an instance using qcow2 disks will
fail as Nova does not populate this value when creating the disk.

Nova needs to at a minimum start populating this field and depending on
the outcome of the thread upstream in Libvirt also potentially handle
the upgrade case where we may need to rebase existing disks in order to
update the metadata.

For now this change simply adds the backing_fmt option to the qemu-img
command line used to create these disks.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3615e8b39badf2a526996a69dc91a92b04cf262e
[2] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg00616.html

Partial-Bug: #1864020
Change-Id: I77ebada015f6522a300be4fa043fb8676458402b

commit_message:
Avoid redis lock's expire_time exceeding timeout.

After n heartbeats, the expireation time of the lock key becomes
(1 + 0.5n) * timeout! Therefore, when the lock holder performs a
long task and exits abnormally, the lock will not be automatically
released in time.

Change-Id: I2437071bb575e95083b0d57a6a0a33aaf8356113

commit_message:
Ensure lease polling raises proper exception

This patch adds the ability to properly translate and raise
VimExceptions when polling the state of the lease.

Change-Id: Ie22808471d4c72e26607e817167e0e2283630b5a

commit_message:
Fix: Create new cache entry when xtremio reaches snap limit

When we reach xtremio_volumes_per_glance_cache, it is not able
to create more clones for the image-volume therefore requires to
create a new cache entry.
Keeping in mind the case in [1], we can get CinderException for
various reasons from different drivers during the clone operation.
So we define a new exception for the xtremio driver to force create
a new cache entry when the limit reaches and not enforce the same
for other drivers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1552734

Conflicts:
        cinder/exception.py
        cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py

Closes-Bug: #1858169

Change-Id: I2bf964d5a7b2048db9be1ea3eb97cd517e112c5b
(cherry picked from commit d22e54c254954bba5b91c38a266308a252c7b62a)

[{'created': '2020-02-19 17:12:18.000000000', 'message': 'PY2/3 compatibility: always use unicode

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for DN/RDN/field
names. Instead, text values are represented as str, the Unicode
text type. This requires to use allways unicode type and for
Python 2 bytes_mode should be set to false.

This patch updates the code to adhere to this behavior.

More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I72ccd258b289ab449fd88a001d5ac68b8bbde576
Closes-Bug: #1862606
Related-Bug: #1798184

commit_message:
PY2/3 compatibility: always use unicode

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for DN/RDN/field
names. Instead, text values are represented as str, the Unicode
text type. This requires to use allways unicode type and for
Python 2 bytes_mode should be set to false.

This patch updates the code to adhere to this behavior.

More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I72ccd258b289ab449fd88a001d5ac68b8bbde576
Closes-Bug: #1862606
Related-Bug: #1798184

commit_message:
add support for multi node deployments to fake driver

This change alters the fake driver to include the hostname
in the deployable list so that each host in a multi node deployment
will have a unique placment RP name.

Change-Id: Ib0e202cac8af5ef7c5028c22dc0654911eb730f5

[{'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-27 14:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-27 15:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

-1 to highlight my thinking and discuss about.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-27 15:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Can't do a minor version bump since we have 2.8.0 in stein.

But looking closer at those changes, in addition to not being properly backported, changing an API is not allowed for backports, so all of those should be reverted."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-02-27 16:13:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree that it shouldn't get backported in the first place. Although we try to follow stable branch policy we technically don't have the corresponding tag [1]. In that particular case the API change is small and backwards compatible, so I'd like to ask you to make an exception here and accept this release.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/stable_follows-policy.html"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-27 17:14:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Very fair point - if this repo doesn't assert following stable policy, then, while still not recommended, there aren't as many restrictions against backporting something like this.

And if it is still considered compatible with the currently released code, then that actually is really good.

Thanks for explaining things Witold."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-02 10:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:

Change-Id: Ie5842e4edcdfef4067da3df15cee565196a84564
'}]

Release monasca-api 2.7.1

Change-Id: Ie5842e4edcdfef4067da3df15cee565196a84564

commit_message:
Fix Exception string arguments

Need to use % for arguments to Exception().

W0715: Exception arguments suggest string formatting might
       be intended (raising-format-tuple)

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I1afc2e4a3b34e548247e8a499fe45602454f36f5

commit_message:
Removing six library.

Since we already migrated fully to Python3, it's time to also remove
bits needed for Python2. One of those libs is six.

Change-Id: Ib984d7b4b3c1048ed091c78986c634689a8ace8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 09:45:01.000000000', 'message': 'Don't use zuul_work_dir in post-stackviz

The stackviz publish job fails with
"The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was:
'zuul_work_dir' is undefined"

Use zuul.project.src.dir instead of zuul_work_dir.

Change-Id: I443d0b4bfb30a06d68321d402802ae1b433bab6b
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use zuul_work_dir in post-stackviz

The stackviz publish job fails with
"The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was:
'zuul_work_dir' is undefined"

Use zuul.project.src.dir instead of zuul_work_dir.

Change-Id: I443d0b4bfb30a06d68321d402802ae1b433bab6b

commit_message:
Don't send heartbeats if driver not initializing correctly

This commit adds is_service_ready method to base Manager class that can be
used to indicate that service is not ready or initialzed success. This is
used to block refreshing Service heartbeats if manager will return false
from is_service_ready.

Closes-Bug:#1853940

Change-Id: Ib85468c703dfa51b03d1838bd422c9b2669bc747

commit_message:
[DNM] just test effect of container update

With https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683981/ after
removing gather_facts, still container-prepare took
30 minute for undercloud, 15 minute for overcloud.
I noticed out of thes 22 minutes were taken by yum_update.sh.
So trying to run update differently.

PS: But still issue looks elsewhere, need to find and dig there.
I might be wrong as possible i am missing some context:
I noticed it affects only master, if true need to figure out what
change could effect it as stein was also containerized.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683981/
Change-Id: I75422140065da824f3d577dd2669931e54623614

commit_message:
[DNM] Try Enabling cache

Since https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:token-cache+(status:open+OR+status:merged)
time in full tempest job is increased significantly, so
let's try enabling cache, and if found true, get the issue fixed
correctly.

i wrongly updated last PS :(, fixing'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-01-03 13:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-03 22:48:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

This would fix any CI usage of building containers but by dropping py2, we would break anyone who actually needed to build the current containers until we have actual centos8 support. I don't recommend using this and I would like to see us stand up centos8 ASAP"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-01-06 06:11:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> This would fix any CI usage of building containers but by dropping
 > py2, we would break anyone who actually needed to build the current
 > containers until we have actual centos8 support. I don't recommend
 > using this and I would like to see us stand up centos8 ASAP

@Alex u mean building container using this role or with pacakages? I agree with making CentOS8 available ASAP but it will take some time as currently CI support and jobs for CentOS8 in TripleO is pending.

This patch was mainly done to unblock kolla team without waiting for CentOS8, as they are willing to move forward by making tripleo container build non-voting and remove py2 support[1]. But this will make development changes in tripleo-common with latest kolla changes hard to test. Only option would be to use pinned commit while installing from source. 

and regarding building with packages, as soon as kolla change merges, in RDO it will be pinned to working commit until CentOS8 is completely ready. This will also have some side effects but i don't see any other option right now.

[1]

<hrw> ykarel: in theory we can always drop voting from tripleo7 job and merge 'drop py2' in kolla. but that would not be nice\x0f
<ykarel> hrw, yup agree as it's kolla decision, but if possible good to wait a few more days :)
<hrw> ykarel: since yesterday I do not remember about Python <3.6 anyway ;D"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-06 14:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

as an end user if kolla drops py2 completely no one can build containers until centos8 support. This is a work around to unblock kolla but it will break anyone who needs work/test container builds themselves until we have centos8.  I would prefer to hold off on this & the kolla patch until we have centos8 packages available so that developers can switch.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-01-06 14:19:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

> <hrw> ykarel: in theory we can always drop voting from tripleo7 job
 > and merge 'drop py2' in kolla. but that would not be nice

It was sarcastic.

I am waiting with py2 patch merge until tripleo change CI job in kolla to centos8."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-03-02 10:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No longer needed, c8 jobs are added in master now.'}]

commit_message:
Run container build with python3 since train on CentOS7

kolla is dropping py2 support with [1], let's run
CentOS7 container build job in Ussuri with python3 as
python3 binaries are available in CentOS7 and container
build works fine with python3 in CentOS7.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691316/

Closes-Bug: #1856678
Change-Id: I2a62063c53e5f34807633bc64a2da5757c9d127b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 06:36:35.000000000', 'message': 'Check volume endpoint availability in the same order

cinder microversion check (api.cinder.get_microversion) checks
volume endpoint availability in a different order as cinderclient()
does. It does not API_VERSIONS setting in horizon.
As a result, when multiple volume endpoints are configured,
get_microversion() accesses a volume endpoint with a different API
version. At the moment cinder v2 and v3 APIs returns the same info,
so it only affects when cinder v1 endpoint is configured.

This commit introduces a new function _find_cinder_url() to
retrieve a volume endpoint considering API_VERSIONS.

get_auth_params_from_request() is no longer needed and the variable
substitutions are now backed to cinderclient(). It was introduced
so that the memoized decorator worked but the memoized decorator
was improved and we no longer need it.

Change-Id: I69b1fc11caf8a78c49e98aba6c538e5f344b14f2
Closes-Bug: #1864133
'}]
commit_message:
Check volume endpoint availability in the same order

cinder microversion check (api.cinder.get_microversion) checks
volume endpoint availability in a different order as cinderclient()
does. It does not API_VERSIONS setting in horizon.
As a result, when multiple volume endpoints are configured,
get_microversion() accesses a volume endpoint with a different API
version. At the moment cinder v2 and v3 APIs returns the same info,
so it only affects when cinder v1 endpoint is configured.

This commit introduces a new function _find_cinder_url() to
retrieve a volume endpoint considering API_VERSIONS.

get_auth_params_from_request() is no longer needed and the variable
substitutions are now backed to cinderclient(). It was introduced
so that the memoized decorator worked but the memoized decorator
was improved and we no longer need it.

Change-Id: I69b1fc11caf8a78c49e98aba6c538e5f344b14f2
Closes-Bug: #1864133

commit_message:
Wrap IPv6 address with brackets

If IPv6 address is not wrapped with brackets OpenFlow rules are
not properly installed.

Change-Id: Ib5836b004fd47671c4cdaa382c9376380beee448
Closes-Bug: #1863892

commit_message:
Do not rely on system ansible

Setup docker registry directly using container-registry
role instead of installing ansible, creating playbook and
executing it.

Mixing system ansible with the zuul one can create issue
like Bug #1829736, this patch handles registry setup
like other zuul tasks.

Related-Bug: #1829736
Change-Id: Ibe0e4225eb8f638bffa52b2bbe76908379b6398d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 10:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'Centralize traffic when LB and member has FIP

When Load Balancer and its member has FIP assigned
and environment is configured to use DVR the member
FIP needs to be centralized. It is current core OVN
limitation, that should be solved in [1].

This patch adds this mechanism to OVN Client and
OVN Octavia provider driver.

It covers cases:

1) FIP association on port that is a member of
   some LB - make it centralized.
2) FIP association on LB VIP - find a members
   FIPs and centralized them.
3) Add a member to LB that has FIP already
   configured - checks if a member has FIP
   and centralize it.
4) The reverse of each of the above cases.

In addition I needed to extend OVN LB member external_id
entry to add an information about member subnet_id
in order to easly track member port from mechanism OVN
driver.
That means I needed also to support both old and new
conventions. This patch adds also this code.

Old convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`

New convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`_`subnet_id`

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1793897

Related-Bug: #1860662

Change-Id: I254f0ac28f7585b699a8238e01ffb37dd70282ef
(cherry picked from networking-ovn commit 57ac38921efa6bbf0bc4a22950355256cc3ebe6d)

commit_message:
Centralize traffic when LB and member has FIP

When Load Balancer and its member has FIP assigned
and environment is configured to use DVR the member
FIP needs to be centralized. It is current core OVN
limitation, that should be solved in [1].

This patch adds this mechanism to OVN Client and
OVN Octavia provider driver.

It covers cases:

1) FIP association on port that is a member of
   some LB - make it centralized.
2) FIP association on LB VIP - find a members
   FIPs and centralized them.
3) Add a member to LB that has FIP already
   configured - checks if a member has FIP
   and centralize it.
4) The reverse of each of the above cases.

In addition I needed to extend OVN LB member external_id
entry to add an information about member subnet_id
in order to easly track member port from mechanism OVN
driver.
That means I needed also to support both old and new
conventions. This patch adds also this code.

Old convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`

New convention:
member_`member_id`_`ip_address`:`port`_`subnet_id`

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1793897

Related-Bug: #1860662

Change-Id: I254f0ac28f7585b699a8238e01ffb37dd70282ef
(cherry picked from networking-ovn commit 57ac38921efa6bbf0bc4a22950355256cc3ebe6d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 00:51:04.000000000', 'message': "Pass the actual target in os-admin-password policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-admin-passowrd policies
which is server's project_id because policy rule is system and project
scoped.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic234e5d4e2d5b8e4a836a59eee36400283027958
"}]
commit_message:
Pass the actual target in os-admin-password policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-admin-passowrd policies
which is server's project_id because policy rule is system and project
scoped.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic234e5d4e2d5b8e4a836a59eee36400283027958

commit_message:
Update the minversion parameter.

Update the minversion parameter to use the python -m pip to install
python packages:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#id185

It's recommend to use this.

Change-Id: Iac4f45c266d0ae08d71814c6667ae3fde9f042a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-16 20:00:04.000000000', 'message': 'Join "build_segment_queries_for_tenant_and_shared_ranges" queries

Instead of returning two different queries, the function now returns
one single query. This will solve the problem detected in the related
bug, where one of the queries can be replaced by an empty list if the
project ID is null.

Now, if the project ID is not null, the query filters the results
using an OR clausule, which joins both conditions. In this case,
because the query can return duplicated results, those are filtered
by the physical network and the VLAN ID; that means the query will
return results with the combination of both parameters always
different.

"HelpersTestWithNetworkSegmentRange" class was fixed. None of the tests
were using the new code paths because the plugin was not added to
the directory. However for those tests only one method is needed to be
mocked, "directory.get_plugin()".

Change-Id: I18e15ea3b3eba15e3c1ec3fce92cd8a933ffc62a
Closes-Bug: #1863423
'}, {'created': '2020-02-17 10:43:47.000000000', 'message': 'Join "build_segment_queries_for_tenant_and_shared_ranges" queries

Change-Id: I18e15ea3b3eba15e3c1ec3fce92cd8a933ffc62a

commit_message:
Join "build_segment_queries_for_tenant_and_shared_ranges" queries

Instead of returning two different queries, the function now returns
one single query. This will solve the problem detected in the related
bug, where one of the queries can be replaced by an empty list if the
project ID is null.

Now, if the project ID is not null, the query filters the results
using an OR clausule, which joins both conditions. In this case, if
the network segmentation is VLAN, because the query can return
duplicated results, those are filtered by the physical network and
the VLAN ID; that means the query will return results with the
combination of both parameters always different.

"HelpersTestWithNetworkSegmentRange" class was fixed. None of the tests
were using the new code paths because the plugin was not added to
the directory. However for those tests only one method is needed to be
mocked, "directory.get_plugin()".

Change-Id: I18e15ea3b3eba15e3c1ec3fce92cd8a933ffc62a
Closes-Bug: #1863423

[{'created': '2020-03-02 08:53:51.000000000', 'message': 'Multi-cells update support.

This add the necessary bits to support multi-cell update.

Basically you need to pass:
 - -e update_cell=true
 - -e overcloud_deploy_script=overcloud_cell_update_prepare.sh
 - --overcloud-stack cell1

so that tripleo-upgrade role does the right thing for updating the
cell setup.

Change-Id: I71fa28b38f00de151ae2ed7c2f043be2b9f7dc00
(cherry picked from commit 249a056e0c39644f7202703bf46270d3a474c633)

'}]
commit_message:
Multi-cells update support.

This add the necessary bits to support multi-cell update.

Basically you need to pass:
 - -e update_cell=true
 - -e overcloud_deploy_script=overcloud_cell_update_prepare.sh
 - --overcloud-stack cell1

so that tripleo-upgrade role does the right thing for updating the
cell setup.

Change-Id: I71fa28b38f00de151ae2ed7c2f043be2b9f7dc00
(cherry picked from commit 249a056e0c39644f7202703bf46270d3a474c633)
(cherry picked from commit 89e3e6b90d2859e2a651884a816c046fac5926e8)

commit_message:
Call bashate and yamllint via pre-commit

* Use pre-commit tool to orchestrate lint execution
* Bumps bashate and yamllint to their current versions
* Fix bashate rules
* The other linters will be migrated in follow-ups

Change-Id: I5eed589e70a21129354043792b6ef463f083ef64

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 20:09:39.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add force parameter for all pcmk_ types

Currently only the property class supports the 'force' boolean to
add --force for all pcs calls. Let's add this support to the other
resource classes as well. Background for this is we want to be able
to create an OCF resource inside a bundle even when that OCF resource
does not exist on the host and in this case pcs requires --force
or it will fail with:

  Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200219-57341-tcztxb create failed: Error: Agent
  'ocf:ovn:ovndb-servers' is not installed or does not provide valid metadata: Metadata query for ocf:ovn:ovndb-servers failed:
  Input/output error, use --force to override

Tested by deploying a full TripleO overcloud with a single OCF resource
passing 'force => true'.

Related-Bug: #1863442

Change-Id: I20eb78a061a334b20f6b2274591c5d313a0af532
"}, {'created': '2020-02-21 16:02:58.000000000', 'message': "Add force parameter for all pcmk_ types

Currently only the property class supports the 'force' boolean to
add --force for all pcs calls. Let's add this support to the other
resource classes as well. Background for this is we want to be able
to create an OCF resource inside a bundle even when that OCF resource
does not exist on the host and in this case pcs requires --force
or it will fail with:

  Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200219-57341-tcztxb create failed: Error: Agent
  'ocf:ovn:ovndb-servers' is not installed or does not provide valid metadata: Metadata query for ocf:ovn:ovndb-servers failed:
  Input/output error, use --force to override

Tested by deploying a full TripleO overcloud with a single OCF resource
passing 'force => true'.

Related-Bug: #1863442

Change-Id: I20eb78a061a334b20f6b2274591c5d313a0af532
"}]
commit_message:
Add force parameter for all pcmk_ types

Currently only the property class supports the 'force' boolean to
add --force for all pcs calls. Let's add this support to the other
resource classes as well. Background for this is we want to be able
to create an OCF resource inside a bundle even when that OCF resource
does not exist on the host and in this case pcs requires --force
or it will fail with:

  Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200219-57341-tcztxb create failed: Error: Agent
  'ocf:ovn:ovndb-servers' is not installed or does not provide valid metadata: Metadata query for ocf:ovn:ovndb-servers failed:
  Input/output error, use --force to override

Tested by deploying a full TripleO overcloud with a single OCF resource
passing 'force => true'.

Related-Bug: #1863442

Change-Id: I20eb78a061a334b20f6b2274591c5d313a0af532

commit_message:
Add config-heat and config-resource options.

This add those two options. They work like their ir overcloud
conterpart.

This add the possibility to add new parameters *during*
update/upgrade/ffwd if required.

Currently adjustement has been done only to update templates.

The other limitation is that this is currently comptatible only in
infrared context and thus is skipped for upstream CI.

Change-Id: I43148a0bc494cf3fc6ff109e7f3a4b94cf751d99
(cherry picked from commit 212c02fb4e6102dbec370f05d7e5b6a7d0c5d2e8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-27 14:49:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use config for layers

Podman keeps a copy of the metadata around in the local container
storage however this may not actually represent the actual layers being
used in the storage. Instead of using the manifest file as the source of
truth for the container layers, we need to look into the container image
config for the layer ids for the local storage. This change adds a
function to swap out the layer metadata with layer information from the
image config if available. If ultimately we cannot find the layers we
throw an exception indicating that it is not found.

Closes-Bug: #1864660
Change-Id: Iec115bfa1ef00112705785a5b3e6ed7dc222070e
(cherry picked from commit 2950738526d7b93553102ceb77717d31c445caa2)
'}]
commit_message:
Use config for layers

Podman keeps a copy of the metadata around in the local container
storage however this may not actually represent the actual layers being
used in the storage. Instead of using the manifest file as the source of
truth for the container layers, we need to look into the container image
config for the layer ids for the local storage. This change adds a
function to swap out the layer metadata with layer information from the
image config if available. If ultimately we cannot find the layers we
throw an exception indicating that it is not found.

Closes-Bug: #1864660
Change-Id: Iec115bfa1ef00112705785a5b3e6ed7dc222070e
(cherry picked from commit 2950738526d7b93553102ceb77717d31c445caa2)

It's useful for debug to get inspect infos from all containers, not just
the ones that are running.
This patch adds another loop to first write the inspect infos, then the

"}]
commit_message:
collect-container-logs: get inspect infos from non-running containers

It's useful for debug to get inspect infos from all containers, not just
the ones that are running.
This patch adds another loop to first write the inspect infos, then the
other loop that goes into running containers to fetch other infos.

Change-Id: I7015dc968b7361ff1a65d63f0d57676bb83603c0

commit_message:
Set 3h timeout for tempest-ipv6-only job

I saw in Neutron queue that default 2h timeout for this job wasn't
enough sometimes. So it's better to keep this job running a bit longer
sometimes rather than recheck everything.

Change-Id: I7c256f1ca5790cd13411d3af78ec97efcfd28b0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 17:10:12.000000000', 'message': 'Filter by owner SGs when retrieving the SG rules

Retrieving the SG rules now is used the admin context. This allows to
get all possible rules, independently of the user calling. The filters
passed and the RBAC policies filter those results, returning only:
- The SG rules belonging to the user.
- The SG rules belonging to a SG owned by the user.

However, if the SG list is too long, the query can take a lot of time.
Instead of this, the filtering is done in the DB query. If no filters
are passed to "get_security_group_rules" and the context is not the
admin context, only the rules specified in the first paragraph will
be retrieved.

Because overwriting the method "get_objects" is too complex, an
intermediate query is done to retrieve the SG rule IDs. Those IDs
will be used as a filter in the "get_objects" call.

Closes-Bug: #1863201

Change-Id: I25d3da929f8d0b6ee15d7b90ec59b9d58a4ae6a5
'}, {'created': '2020-02-19 17:15:48.000000000', 'message': 'Filter by owner SGs when retrieving the SG rules

Retrieving the SG rules now is used the admin context. This allows to
get all possible rules, independently of the user calling. The filters
passed and the RBAC policies filter those results, returning only:
- The SG rules belonging to the user.
- The SG rules belonging to a SG owned by the user.

However, if the SG list is too long, the query can take a lot of time.
Instead of this, the filtering is done in the DB query. If no filters
are passed to "get_security_group_rules" and the context is not the
admin context, only the rules specified in the first paragraph will
be retrieved.

Because overwriting the method "get_objects" is too complex, an
intermediate query is done to retrieve the SG rule IDs. Those IDs
will be used as a filter in the "get_objects" call.

Closes-Bug: #1863201

Change-Id: I25d3da929f8d0b6ee15d7b90ec59b9d58a4ae6a5
'}, {'created': '2020-02-20 10:07:21.000000000', 'message': 'Filter by owner SGs when retrieving the SG rules

Retrieving the SG rules now is used the admin context. This allows to
get all possible rules, independently of the user calling. The filters

- The SG rules belonging to a SG owned by the user.

However, if the SG list is too long, the query can take a lot of time.
Instead of this, the filtering is done in the DB query. If no filters

Because overwriting the method "get_objects" is too complex, an

will be used as a filter in the "get_objects" call.

Closes-Bug: #1863201

Change-Id: I25d3da929f8d0b6ee15d7b90ec59b9d58a4ae6a5
'}]
commit_message:
Filter by owner SGs when retrieving the SG rules

Retrieving the SG rules now is used the admin context. This allows to
get all possible rules, independently of the user calling. The filters
passed and the RBAC policies filter those results, returning only:
- The SG rules belonging to the user.
- The SG rules belonging to a SG owned by the user.

However, if the SG list is too long, the query can take a lot of time.
Instead of this, the filtering is done in the DB query. If no filters
are passed to "get_security_group_rules" and the context is not the
admin context, only the rules specified in the first paragraph will
be retrieved.

Because overwriting the method "get_objects" is too complex, an
intermediate query is done to retrieve the SG rule IDs. Those IDs
will be used as a filter in the "get_objects" call.

Closes-Bug: #1863201

Change-Id: I25d3da929f8d0b6ee15d7b90ec59b9d58a4ae6a5

commit_message:
Log vms' console output in scenario tests

If any of scenario tests will fail in check_remote_connectivity(),
it will log console output of the VMs which should make
debugging of test failures easier.

Change-Id: Ib6b2e6ea5c4465ec76699bf42b82e2bae448436d

subject: Add new filter `host_name` to segment list
messages:
[{'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-01-29 14:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-01-29 14:32:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-12 16:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-13 09:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-17 14:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2020-02-27 01:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

There is failover_segment_id or failover_segment object associated in the Host List respone.
In my opinion, this work is duplicated.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-27 05:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> There is failover_segment_id or failover_segment object associated
 > in the Host List respone.
 > In my opinion, this work is duplicated.

 > There is failover_segment_id or failover_segment object associated
 > in the Host List respone.
 > In my opinion, this work is duplicated.

Hi Suzhengwei,
there is failover_segment_id associated with host list response, but here <segment_id> is required argument.

This patch is for to get segment object/details which is associated to host, where providing host name as optional filter parameter. Here just extra filter added.
IMO this work is not duplicated.

$ openstack segment list --host fake-virtualbox
    +--------------------------------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-----------------+
    | uuid                                 | name        | description | service_type | recovery_method |
    +--------------------------------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-----------------+
    | 5406c157-6347-403e-ae6a-08817b83f7b9 | new_segment | None        | COMPUTE      | auto            |
    +--------------------------------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-----------------+'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2020-02-27 06:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

Thanks for you reply. I have seen what you wants.
There is another solution. It needs to adjust hosts api， making segment_id an optional parameter.
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/instance-ha/?expanded=show-host-details-detail,list-notifications-detail#hosts-hosts
GET /hosts
GET /hosts/{host_id}
In cli:
#masakari host list [--segment segment_ident]
#masakari host show host_ident'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2020-03-02 01:47:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> There is another solution. It needs to adjust hosts api， making
 > segment_id an optional parameter.
 > https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/instance-ha/?expanded=show-host-details-detail,list-notifications-detail#hosts-hosts
 > GET /hosts
 > GET /hosts/{host_id}
 > In cli:
 > #masakari host list [--segment segment_ident]
 > #masakari host show host_ident

I think that's the ideal solution though it's a big design change.
+1, Let's see what others think about it."}]

commit_message:
Add new filter `host_name` to segment list

Add command parameter support to segment list command to filter out
segments based on host input parameter.

Change-Id: I61997bf1e10b52a9afbc0c70ca5315ad465a7af9
Depends-On: I54df91cbd84482368b45163b1243cdefd051c97a
Implements: blueprint host-input-parameter-to-segment-list

commit_message:
Allow to switch from parallel to serial update.

We can encounter corner case pacemaker issues with parallel role
update. While we solve them, we need a way to disable parallel role
update.

Using a idiom mentionned in the ansible documentation[1] we start role
update by batch. When batch is 1, this is serial update, one role
after another.

This is the default.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_async.html

Change-Id: I03378557653d07113fa70782e5d22bf5e3e969b8

Build failed.

Build failed.

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered finger://d0fe4b8af32b/6d3f1388bbea4ab4b668f6c08933b211 : RETRY_LIMIT in 7s'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2020-02-11 09:44:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

Sorry, I understand why you'd like to change the AZ value, but to be clear, the RequestSpec AZ value shouldn't be changed.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1861964/comments/2 and https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/availability-zones.html#implications-for-moving-servers

If you force moving a instance that was in a AZ to another host that's in another AZ, then you basically say to Nova 'meh about AZs'. If so, yes indeed, you would have some problems with resizing for example.

That's why it's no longer possible to force moving an instance by live-migrating if you use a API microversion that is more than 2.29. 
Since we can't change the behaviour of microversions less than 2.29, that's also why we tell operators in this case to *not* live-migrate with a specific host value so that the scheduler would verify the AZ.

If you *really* want to force migrating a instance to another host, either you check the target AZ (to make sure it's the same) *before* asking to migrate, or you force migrate it to another host, do what you want, and then force migrate the instance *back* to the original AZ.

Hope that helps.
FWIW, marking this bugfix as -2 as I don't think we need to fix the bug since it's closed now (as WONTFIX)"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-02-11 12:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/706647/5 : FAILURE in 2h 37m 33s'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-02-11 12:57:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Sorry, I understand why you'd like to change the AZ value, but to
 > be clear, the RequestSpec AZ value shouldn't be changed.
 > 
 > See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1861964/comments/2 and
 > https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/availability-zones.html#implications-for-moving-servers
 > 
 > If you force moving a instance that was in a AZ to another host
 > that's in another AZ, then you basically say to Nova 'meh about
 > AZs'. If so, yes indeed, you would have some problems with resizing
 > for example.
 > 
 > That's why it's no longer possible to force moving an instance by
 > live-migrating if you use a API microversion that is more than
 > 2.29.
 > Since we can't change the behaviour of microversions less than
 > 2.29, that's also why we tell operators in this case to *not*
 > live-migrate with a specific host value so that the scheduler would
 > verify the AZ.
 > 
 > If you *really* want to force migrating a instance to another host,
 > either you check the target AZ (to make sure it's the same)
 > *before* asking to migrate, or you force migrate it to another
 > host, do what you want, and then force migrate the instance *back*
 > to the original AZ.
 > 
 > Hope that helps.
 > FWIW, marking this bugfix as -2 as I don't think we need to fix the
 > bug since it's closed now (as WONTFIX)

hi, just for curiosity. Are you saying it is basically not possible to rename a AZ by design?"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2020-02-11 13:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-40955 : FAILURE in 3h 18m 43s'}, {'account_id': 30736, 'date': '2020-02-12 02:23:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

> Sorry, I understand why you'd like to change the AZ value, but to
 > be clear, the RequestSpec AZ value shouldn't be changed.
 > 
 > See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1861964/comments/2 and
 > https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/availability-zones.html#implications-for-moving-servers
 > 
 > If you force moving a instance that was in a AZ to another host
 > that's in another AZ, then you basically say to Nova 'meh about
 > AZs'. If so, yes indeed, you would have some problems with resizing
 > for example.
 > 
 > That's why it's no longer possible to force moving an instance by
 > live-migrating if you use a API microversion that is more than
 > 2.29.
 > Since we can't change the behaviour of microversions less than
 > 2.29, that's also why we tell operators in this case to *not*
 > live-migrate with a specific host value so that the scheduler would
 > verify the AZ.
 > 
 > If you *really* want to force migrating a instance to another host,
 > either you check the target AZ (to make sure it's the same)
 > *before* asking to migrate, or you force migrate it to another
 > host, do what you want, and then force migrate the instance *back*
 > to the original AZ.
 > 
 > Hope that helps.
 > FWIW, marking this bugfix as -2 as I don't think we need to fix the
 > bug since it's closed now (as WONTFIX)

Thanks for your explanation.
By the way, I have another question, 
if the aggregation's availability_zone is changed, 
the value of availability_zone in request_sepcs isn't updated,
and the migration of VMs will be failed when scheduling.
How would you recommend approaching this problem."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2020-02-19 09:34:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hey HYSong,

Discussing over a Gerrit change is not exactly easy, so if you can ping me in IRC, I'm 'bauzas' there.

> if the aggregation's availability_zone is changed, 
> the value of availability_zone in request_sepcs isn't updated,
> and the migration of VMs will be failed when scheduling.
> How would you recommend approaching this problem.

To be honest, modifying AZ names would be a problem for users, right? 
For example, say I'm a user, I see two AZs by one day : AZ1 and AZ2.
Then, the next day, I look again at the AZs and then I see : AZ1 and AZ3. If so, I would be afraid : what became AZ2 ?

That's why Nova doesn't support changing a AZ name for a aggregate. If you *really* want to do it, then you need to modify the instances and request specs directly by querying the DB.

Hope you understand it.

-Sylvain"}]

commit_message:
Update request_specs.availability_zone during live migration

This change fix bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1861964

When living migrate vm with certain target,
the value of availability_zone in request_specs should be updated.
And the migrated vms should use new availability_zone
in request_specs when scheduling instead of old availability_zone.

Change-Id: Ie4706a4958739a8ff46fbf0b9f586dd0f79c2bc5
Closes-Bug: #1861964

damn same problem though         python3-virtualenv

        {% else %}

        python-virtualenv

        {% endif %}

​

- name: Create mock group

  become: true

  group:

    name: mock

    state: present

​

- name: Add user to mock group

  become: true

  user:

    name: '{{ ansible_user_id }}'

    groups: mock

    append: true

​

- name: Ensure DLRN dir is present

  file:

    path: '{{ build_repo_dir }}/DLRN/'

    state: directory

​

- name: Remove data files from previous runs

  shell:

    rm -rf '{{ build_repo_dir }}/DLRN/*'

  args:

    warn: false

  register: result

  changed_when: result.stdout or result.stderr

​

- name: drop in the templated version of projects.ini

  template:

    src: projects.ini.j2

    dest: '{{ build_repo_dir }}/DLRN/projects.ini'

​

# https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1863632

# Install virtualenv into dlrn-venv

- name: Install zipp < 0.6 when queens

  # noqa 403

  pip:

    name: zipp<0.6.0

    virtualenv: "{{ build_repo_dir }}/dlrn-venv"

  when: release in ['queens']

​

- name: Install and update pip

  # noqa 403

  pip:

    name: pip

    virtualenv: "{{ build_repo_dir }}/dlrn-venv"

    state: latest

    extra_args: --upgrade

​

- name: Pip install rdopkg

  pip:

    name: rdopkg

    virtualenv: "{{ build_repo_dir }}/dlrn-venv"

    version: 0.47.3

  when: not dlrn_pre_installed|bool

​

- name: Pip install DLRN

  # noqa 403

  pip:

    name: dlrn

    virtualenv: "{{ build_repo_dir }}/dlrn-venv"

    state: latest

  when: not dlrn_pre_installed|bool

commit_message:
Revert sudo and six workarounds for virtualenv 20.0.1 issues

Reverts the workarounds added for the Partial-Bug below.
This is to fix issues described in Related-Bug. 

* ensure sudo is not called in ci.centos
* remove patches to fix lp#1862724 
* add python-virtualenv for queens branch centos-7

Partial-Bug: #1862724
Related-Bug: #1863632
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/708791
Change-Id: I3d9bd1aa3b498890a2a773a838df78b53d2c30e6

'}, {'created': '2020-02-28 16:51:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add explicit contextlib2 0.5<0.6 for queens ancient virtualenv

As described in related bug we need to install a particular version
of contextlib2 to fix an issue with very old virtualenv installed.
Installing contextlib2 in this way seems to pull in a new enough
version of virtualenv without causing other dependency issues.

Related-Bug: 1863632

commit_message:
Add explicit contextlib2 0.5<0.6 for queens ancient virtualenv

As described in related bug we need to install a particular version
of contextlib2 to fix an issue with very old virtualenv installed.
Installing contextlib2 in this way seems to pull in a new enough
version of virtualenv without causing other dependency issues.

Also add tags: notest to skip molecule testing which makes
tox-molecule job fail, ideally this task shouldn't run except queens
release.

Related-Bug: 1863632
Change-Id: Iff5ed3f7f5196016b6cd807ee9408c204b349498

[{'created': '2020-02-26 10:12:52.000000000', 'message': 'CentOS 8: Actually disable EPEL, and epel-modular

The EPEL repository was not included in the repository mapping file,
repos.yaml. This causes the EPEL repository to be enabled in the CentOS
8 base image. There is also another EPEL reposistory, epel-modular,
which is enabled by default after installing epel-release.

This change adds mappings for epel and epel-modular repos to repos.yaml,
and disables epel-modular in the base image.

'}, {'created': '2020-02-26 12:58:37.000000000', 'message': "Actually disable EPEL, and epel-modular

The disable_extra_repos macro accepts a list as its only argument. We
were calling it like this to disable EPEL:

disable_extra_repos('epel')

The macro interpreted this as a request to disable three repos, e, p, l.
Thanks Python! Type validation to be improved separately.

Additionally, on CentOS 8 the EPEL repository was not included in the
repository mapping file, repos.yaml. There is also another EPEL
repository on CentOS 8, epel-modular, which is enabled by default after
installing epel-release.

This change adds mappings for epel and epel-modular repos to repos.yaml,
and fixes the disabling of epel in the base image, as well as disabling
epel-modular.

There are some cases where EPEL is still used (it seemed a bit too
easy...), and the repository has been enabled for these images:

* bifrost-base (nginx)
* ironic-conductor (C7 only, shellinabox)
* freezer-base (C7 only, trickle)
* mariadb (pv)
* mongodb (C7 only, mongodb)
* nova-spicehtml5proxy (C7 only, spice-html5)
* telegraf (C7 only, python2-pip)

A few other things were changed:

* ironic-conductor does not require the ceph repo
* python3-pika is no longer installed in the openstack-base image

Related: blueprint remove-epel

Change-Id: I3761825239dfc462072383cde6276c4fb3e1bf12
