Please give some hints.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2020-02-21 05:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-21 16:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's a bit late to change the deliverables for Ussuri (as we are past the freeze for that) but this is sufficiently peripheral that I think we can make an exception.

We'll need a corresponding change in openstack/releases creating a separate deliverable file for mistral-extra."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-21 16:57:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree with Thierry's assessment. A little late, but should be OK."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-21 18:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from make_mistral_extra_separate_deliverable to project-update'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-24 08:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I am okay with this. Keep in mind this will need to be applied for old stable branches too, so remember to edit the files in the release repo appropriately.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-24 12:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Actually I would not change stable branches -- those deliverables were released in a certain way, and we should not rewrite history. Only Ussuri deliverable files should be fixed.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-24 21:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

If the release team is happy, I'm happy :)"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-25 01:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-02-25 04:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Follow-up in the releases repo: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709655

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-02-26 07:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can we somehow move this forward please?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Actually I would not change stable branches -- those deliverables

Then the add release will propose the same deliverable with them IIRC. It's not a problem, it's just to be aware of the things."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:29:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Can we somehow move this forward please?

It's too soon to merge, but should be ready to merge soon. We always give some time to the community (including tc members) to evaluate this decision."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-02-27 08:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, thanks :) Understood.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-27 13:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 04:41:51.000000000', 'message': "Make 'mistral-extra' a separate deliverable

* 'mistral-extra' repo is now becoming an independent deliverable
  related to Mistral. We've already moved OpenStack actions over to
  'mistral-extra' and ripping them out from the main 'mistral-repo'.
  So 'mistral-extra' should now be a separate dependency for projects
  (e.g. TripleO) that want to use OpenStack actions. We're also
  planning to put more things into this repository like other types
  of actions or YAQL functions, common utilities used for developing
  actions, management tools etc.

Change-Id: Id265f6d8a73166f25ae24c18b7f52f5f9aa3baeb
"}]
commit_message:
Make 'mistral-extra' a separate deliverable

* 'mistral-extra' repo is now becoming an independent deliverable
  related to Mistral. We've already moved OpenStack actions over to
  'mistral-extra' and ripping them out from the main 'mistral-repo'.
  So 'mistral-extra' should now be a separate dependency for projects
  (e.g. TripleO) that want to use OpenStack actions. We're also
  planning to put more things into this repository like other types
  of actions or YAQL functions, common utilities used for developing
  actions, management tools etc.

Change-Id: Id265f6d8a73166f25ae24c18b7f52f5f9aa3baeb

commit_message:
Ensure list of pods items is retrieved

Right now we attempt to retrieve the list of pods without
fetching the items field returned on the kubernetes response,
causing the wrong element to be fetched.

This commit fixes the issue by getting the list of pods
through the items.

Closes-bug: 1864451
Change-Id: I0144f68900011ba3b5c6373a439dc1df3a68f8ed

commit_message:
Reminder: show_multiple_locations still deprecated

In response to a question on the mailing list [0] about the status
of the show_multiple_locations option (scheduled for removal since
Pike), update the Train release notes to make it clear both that the
option has not been removed, but that it continues to be deprecated.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012883.html

Change-Id: I9e3d8eb3a5bddb7ab8957585d0d4181dce87c8a3

'test_delete_saving_image' fails because image
snapshot is produced quicker than tempest being able
to catch the 'SAVING' transition.

Hence, the testcase needs following refinement:-
1. testcase should catch the state of image in 'SAVING'
   state only and then delete the image.
   By this case, we can get the idea that image is
   deleted in 'SAVING' state only and the testcase will
   achieve its moto.
2. If the image trasits to any the state other then
   'SAVING', testcase can just delete the image.

commit_message:
Added fix to 'test_delete_saving_image' testcase

'test_delete_saving_image' fails because image
snapshot is produced quicker than tempest being able
to catch the 'SAVING' transition.

Hence, the testcase needs following refinement:-
1. testcase should catch the state of image in 'SAVING'
   state only and then delete the image.
   By this case, we can get the idea that image is
   deleted in 'SAVING' state only and the testcase will
   achieve its motto.
2. If the image trasits to a state other than
   'SAVING', testcase can just delete the image.

Related-Bug: #1713163
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I50606c67e9f626935878aaa61d0adbc236272054

commit_message:
WIP: CentOS 8

Needs to be split into separate changes.

Issues:
* veth bounce kills IP on breth1
* ntp package not available on CentOS 8

Change-Id: Ib8be24d9a2baebcd890a50eda8102ec65256b318

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-02-17 14:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

At point "2020-02-17 05:27:24" in the log [1] the command made by [2] looks like it's getting additional new lines added which breaks the interpolation of the command. At least it looks like an extra newline problem to me because I see additional date entries in the log where I should only see one:

2020-02-17 05:27:24 |   cmd: (blah blah blah)
2020-02-17 05:27:24 |     ANSIBLE_CACHE_PLUGIN=...
2020-02-17 05:27:24 |     ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH=...

I think (from lines 24/25 of [1]) that the following variables contain new lines:

      - "{{ calling_ansible_environment_variables|join(' ') }}"
      - "{{ ceph_ansible_environment_variables|join(' ') }}"

Most likely the calling_ansible_environment_variables which is basically getting whatever the config-download ansible got. 

Either we require these vars to not contain new lines or we modify lines 24/25 to go from this:

  - "{{ calling_ansible_environment_variables|join(' ') }}"

to something like this:

  - "{{ calling_ansible_environment_variables|join(' ')|replace('\n', '') }}"


[1] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/15/706815/7/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-rhel-8-scenario001-standalone-rdo/a444f63/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone_deploy.log.txt.gz

[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_uuid/tasks/gather.yml'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-02-17 20:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

> At point "2020-02-17 05:27:24" in the log [1] the command made by
 > [2] looks like it's getting additional new lines added which breaks
 > the interpolation of the command.

If not handling those new lines is a bug:

 https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1863629

Then this might help:

 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708252/

I'm not crazy about this fix; why should there be new lines be there?'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-02-18 03:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-02-18 03:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2020-02-19 09:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-02-24 07:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-02-26 02:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2020-02-26 07:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-02-27 15:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Move package_update worflow related functionality to utils

This moves the functionality to utils, however we'll still use
the mistral actions. Once we've new release of tripleo-common
we can switch to call them directly from python-tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I968e6d8c1c6bd87f9b5cb52cd83893367d5043b7
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706170
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/708252

Remove old standalone.yaml

The correct file to use with the tripleo deploy command is
`environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml`.

Change-Id: I871b58becf1f5e874a4c2e3c6da7a0e6bf61dff0

commit_message:
Multi-cells update support.

This add the necessary bits to support multi-cell update.

Basically you need to pass:
 - -e update_cell=true
 - -e overcloud_deploy_script=overcloud_cell_update_prepare.sh
 - --overcloud-stack cell1

so that tripleo-upgrade role does the right thing for updating the
cell setup.

Change-Id: I71fa28b38f00de151ae2ed7c2f043be2b9f7dc00

commit_message:
Move to tox-embedded code linting and add bugbear

Avoiding flake8 in test-requirements ensures that the
pypi release won't require it for installation. Also
add bugbear which finds some small common causes for bugs.
Fix one fallout in the code

Change-Id: Ie97d33401e3c989195b4ba75399dd21049670855

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-12 11:17:58.000000000', 'message': 'Added support for using source from github tarball

* github provided source tarball expands like this:
  https://github.com/openstack/<project>/archive/<version>.tar.gz
  but openstack tarballs ends like this:
  http://tarballs.openstack.org/<project>/<project>-<version>.tar.gz
  which leads renderspec failed to determine version.
* The patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I588e3fa3535494c63e9976b1644afb2d351194be
'}]
commit_message:
Added support for using source from github tarball

* github provided source tarball expands like this:
  https://github.com/openstack/<project>/archive/<version>.tar.gz
  but openstack tarballs ends like this:
  http://tarballs.openstack.org/<project>/<project>-<version>.tar.gz
  which leads renderspec failed to determine version.
* The patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I588e3fa3535494c63e9976b1644afb2d351194be

commit_message:
Add custom ansible-lint rule for Role Names

Roles can no longer have a "-" in them according to the upstream ansible
documentation[0]. This change adds a new ansible-lint rule to check if
the role name is respecting the Ansible recommendations.

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/dev_guide/developing_collections.html#roles-directory

Change-Id: I46bfbc3a78d71ba675697b1e3ce95286e9cb7941
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Yes, this needs a spec, because it's not at all clear why we need this."}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2019-04-04 12:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2019-04-04 12:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Why would a driver be doing anything directly with Nova?
 > 
 > This is filed and marked as a bug, but I think something like this
 > probably could use a spec to make clear what is being done and why.
 > The bug at least doesn't do a good job of explaining what the "bug"
 > is.

 > Why would a driver be doing anything directly with Nova?
 > 
 > This is filed and marked as a bug, but I think something like this
 > probably could use a spec to make clear what is being done and why.
 > The bug at least doesn't do a good job of explaining what the "bug"
 > is.

Hi Sean, I am working on the development of Unity cross array volume migration feature. In my implementation, the lun will be moved from source Unity to target Unity, the original volume will be keep using, but it is needed to re-attach to nova instances. So I added create_server_volume and delete_server_volume methods to implement volume re-attach operation. The driver feature is under development, I will send out the review once the development completed.'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2019-04-04 12:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 >

 > probably could use a spec to make clear what is being done and why.
 > The bug at least doesn't do a good job of explaining what the "bug"
 > is.

I already registered a bp for this commit: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/nova-api-attach-detach-volume'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2019-04-04 12:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2019-04-03 07:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add create, delete server volume methods for nova api

Add create_server_volume and delete_server_volume methods for
class cinder.compute.nova.API. Drivers may need to invoke them
to attach or detach volumes from nova instances.

Change-Id: If524963ea32712ef9d62135e717cef80868d1f43
Closes-bug: #1822947
'}, {'created': '2019-04-04 12:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Supports volume attach, detach in nova api

Adds create_server_volume and delete_server_volume methods for
class cinder.compute.nova.API. Drivers may need to invoke them
to attach or detach volumes for nova instances.

Change-Id: If524963ea32712ef9d62135e717cef80868d1f43
Implements: blueprint nova-api-attach-detach-volume
'}]
commit_message:
Supports volume attach, detach in nova api

Adds create_server_volume and delete_server_volume methods for
class cinder.compute.nova.API. Drivers may need to invoke them
to attach or detach volumes for nova instances.

Change-Id: If524963ea32712ef9d62135e717cef80868d1f43
Implements: blueprint nova-api-attach-detach-volume

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I think I'm not a fun to fix this bug in this way, that means if we
 > pass a value like {'key1': '1.23'}, and cinder will convert it to
 > {'key1': '1'}. which is very wired.
 > 
 > If we ensure that the float type doesn't make any sense for qos, we
 > could forbid it in API.

The story is come from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598090/, Eric Harney suggest (via email) converting floats to integers in API layer, let's see is there any comments."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-12-06 18:54:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I am concerned by this.  It seems to me that the change should be made in drivers that can't handle a float to convert the value instead of assuming that everyone should use an int."}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-12-17 21:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Jay and Eric,
Can you, please, agree which way do you want this resolved?
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598090/ did the fix in the driver and Eric gave -2. Yong did this in common code so it can be used for all drivers, and Jay you gave -1.

Need clarity to help resolve it.
We can create another helper function and use it in the driver. That way only drivers that use int can utilize it.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2019-03-19 15:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

How do we proceed forward with it?'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-03-29 13:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think this patch has the right idea for how to fix this.

Like I said on the other patchset, fixing this in drivers doesn't make sense.  We don't need to support fractional (float) IOPS values for any driver.  Nobody wants to set a limit of "1000.43 IOPS".  So, we should just use integer values to make life easy for everyone.'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2019-04-03 06:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2019-04-03 06:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Convert float type value of QoS specs to interger

When creating QoS specs, convert float type value of QoS specs to
integer, if float type QoS specs are passed to driver directly,
unexpected error may happened. For example, Dell EMC Unity does
not support float type QoS value, it will raise exception if float
is passed. Since float type value does not make sense for QoS
(iops, bandwidth should be integer), so we convert it to integer
in Cinder API.

Change-Id: Ib80c9a469189a34401784041db15f9714b967058
Closes-bug: #1802468

commit_message:
Add list security group rules API test

This test checks that regular user can see all SG rules which belongs
to his tenant OR belongs to security group owned by his tenant.

This test also ensures that SG rules from different tenants and Security
Groups are not visible for regular user.

Fix for master branch
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/681910

Fix for stable/train
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/688715

Fix for stable/stein
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/688716

Fix for stable/rocky
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/688717

Fix for stable/queens
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/688719

Change-Id: Ic2e97ab8162d10e507ef83b9af0840e7311f0587
Related-Bug: #1824248

commit_message:
[ceph-mon] Add mon hosts as per msgr2 protocol

This is to update mon_host configuration to support both v1 and v2
of messenger.

ex: mon_host = [v1:172.29.0.11:6790/0,v2:172.29.0.11:3300/0]

Change-Id: I02785ea42c07d1aecbef2cf0c32dd6a1a236659f
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: fix constructed compose
messages:
[{'account_id': 31552, 'date': '2020-01-28 14:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-01-28 14:25:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 31552, 'date': '2020-01-28 15:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-02-17 14:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

[{'created': '2020-02-20 12:51:37.000000000', 'message': "Ensure bc package is installed for l3 ping tests.

When running the l3 ping tests we get the following
error: bc: command not found.
Let's make sure the package is present in the system
when generating the scripts.

Change-Id: I32ad402dc7e42d85e574bf1273664bc7d6d1f9a5
(cherry picked from commit 359eb6b82718ab2506d7ba63d116e7a2ce3a3211)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure bc package is installed for l3 ping tests.

When running the l3 ping tests we get the following
error: bc: command not found.
Let's make sure the package is present in the system
when generating the scripts.

Change-Id: I32ad402dc7e42d85e574bf1273664bc7d6d1f9a5
(cherry picked from commit 359eb6b82718ab2506d7ba63d116e7a2ce3a3211)

commit_message:
Add support for copy-image import method

This change adds support for copy-image import method which will
copy existing images into multiple stores.

Change-Id: I748a8fb3dbaf9c2e4d887a2ecd4325e27a8429c4
bp: copy-image-multiple-stores

oslo.utils 4.1.0

Release an important bugfix related to scientific notation format
in qemu's given outputs.

Change-Id: I976720f7bf9471b9017466a5a40956f9112485fc

commit_message:
CI: Add addressing on external network

This is to allow CI testing of network connectivity.

Note only "primary" node gets an address on it.
Hence, "primary" becomes our fake external router.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/709361

Change-Id: I05592888796107d6de95b940c42b2bff73ac0669

commit_message:
Remove _post_lb_resource()

In lower-constraints we now have openstacksdk 0.36.0 meaning that tags
for Octavia resources are normally supported. This commit removes the
hack that was making POST requests on LB resources manually to
workaround the fact that older versions of the lib were not supporting
tags.

Change-Id: I22f403407b4d83af3cf7093a15318e40b0186386

commit_message:
Add support for multi-store import

This change adds support for providing multiple target
stores where image can be imported.

Co-authored-by: Erno Kuvaja <jokke@usr.fi>
Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>

bp: import-multi-stores

messages: [{'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-02-26 19:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-02-26 19:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit ac158d19f5d0b5085b8c2fb2ba17cebd164f6582'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-02-26 20:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 19:55:03.000000000', 'message': "Use more permissive regex to remove the offending 127.0.1.1

line from /etc/hosts

Ubuntu always uses 127.0.1.1 for that with some tricky sauce
around `hostname` depending on whether it contains '.' or not.
And when I mean `hostname` it's the one returned by `hostname`
command with no arguments.

ansible_hostname is always a single word so we can match on that.

I did not want to remove just any 127.0.1.1 in case someone
is using it for other purposes. :-)

Change-Id: I8bd3d42a5e3bd0f63336ed60a0af90d52b1650d6
Closes-bug: #1862739
(cherry picked from commit adbe115e39ef2320e2e1ab57f97d5191282951d7)
"}]
commit_message:
Use more permissive regex to remove the offending 127.0.1.1

line from /etc/hosts

Ubuntu always uses 127.0.1.1 for that with some tricky sauce
around `hostname` depending on whether it contains '.' or not.
And when I mean `hostname` it's the one returned by `hostname`
command with no arguments.

ansible_hostname is always a single word so we can match on that.

I did not want to remove just any 127.0.1.1 in case someone
is using it for other purposes. :-)

Change-Id: I8bd3d42a5e3bd0f63336ed60a0af90d52b1650d6
Closes-bug: #1862739
(cherry picked from commit adbe115e39ef2320e2e1ab57f97d5191282951d7)

commit_message:
Remove libvirt package

This re-apply the reverted in I9551aa04c81387c672d4c276ac8d58b2f85fb9ad
Problem has been fixed in master and will be backported as part of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707401

Nova services are now running in the containers but we still have
libvirt packages installed on Overcloud systems. This change removes
libvirt packages that are not needed any more.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/707401
Closes-Bug: 1842932
(cherry picked from commit 359bc74c7602b27a803039557c9c5767e2bf0df6)

Change-Id: Ib1a3ce4d102999a06a8dc73486597d7aaf03be96

commit_message:
Switch monasca-* to cycle-with-rc

Deliverables following the cycle-with-intermediary model are expected
to release multiple times throughout the development cycle. Since
monasca-* only released once last cycle, and has not done a release
yet this cycle, this proposes changing the release model to cycle-with-rc
so the expectation is only that it will release an RC by the end of
the cycle prior to doing the final release.

For the team, please respond to this patch in one of the following ways:

* -1 this patch and follow up with an intermediary release
* +1 this patch and we will switch over the release model
* -1 this patch, but acknowledge a release will be done prior to the
  RC1 deadline.

Change-Id: I0779e84405efc6447dcf76aaa1f9450244d4833a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

I don't think this is necessary. If you look at the flows here, we can trace where these are updated:

then to listeners: https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/controller/worker/v1/flows/load_balancer_flows.py#L164-L166

which does mark every subobject ACTIVE: https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/controller/worker/v1/tasks/database_tasks.py#L984-L988

since we have pools: https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/controller/worker/v1/tasks/database_tasks.py#L1002-L1008

it will do pool + HM: https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/controller/worker/v1/tasks/database_tasks.py#L1034-L1036

I'm curious if there might be some other issue happening here that's interfering? We have scenario tests that validate the entirety of the single-create flow."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-27 00:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Fix create loadbalancer error.

When create loadbalancer and pools on cascade,
There are not any codes about creating pools, health_monitor and members.
So, the provisioning_status of them would be PENDING_CREATE forever.

https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006994

Change-Id: Idb55d58af0893ed965663f4192c707a0be8a4ae2
Signed-off-by: yuanrunsen <yuanrunsen@unitedstack.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 08:38:48.000000000', 'message': 'Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the the replacement resouce.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
'}, {'created': '2020-02-25 03:07:50.000000000', 'message': "Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
"}]
commit_message:
Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23

commit_message:
Switch to new engine facade for Route objects

The Route object is an OVO front for the SubnetRoute model.  Enable the
new Engine Facade code for this object.

Closes-Bug: #1831919
Change-Id: I5ce1516d38e59d3254b6f684da1384ffd1cecb50
(cherry picked from commit a9094838a9346ceb0ed54b19646ac8dbf88d6df0)

commit_message:
Deprecate neutron-fwaas-dashboard as stadium project

It's sad but as we still don't have any maintainers for this project,
I think it's time to start process of deprecating this as part of
the Neutron stadium.

Change-Id: I04221332f373aa6587c6bca151776fce3260517f

commit_message:
Deprecate neutron-fwaas as stadium project

It's sad but as we still don't have any maintainers for this project,
I think it's time to start process of deprecating this as part of
the Neutron stadium.

Change-Id: I8c8fc6b5ab8a169a0f4a7d77153bb1dfc1530b8e

commit_message:
Migrate charm-manila to use Zaza

Additionally, this change corrects a template to ensure
that Manila can run on slightly older releases

Change-Id: Ie7eb9613f6b264ce4a681b89f68d1034a1c61f11
Closes-Bug: #1828424
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/182

subject: Release monasca-persister 1.12.1
messages:
[{'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-27 14:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-27 15:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-27 15:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

I consider that more of a bugfix - one that required the addition of a config option to work around.

We normally do not want to add new config options in backports. But in this case, the default for the option keeps the behavior consistent with the existing behavior, so it is safe to do.

The first release in stein was 1.13.0, so we really only have the bugfix version to work with here.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-27 16:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > I consider that more of a bugfix - one that required the addition
 > of a config option to work around.
 > 
 > We normally do not want to add new config options in backports. But
 > in this case, the default for the option keeps the behavior
 > consistent with the existing behavior, so it is safe to do.
 > 
 > The first release in stein was 1.13.0, so we really only have the
 > bugfix version to work with here.

Ok make sense'}]

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Remove unused 'build_sphinx' configuration

We call 'sphinx-build' directly now. No need to keep this legacy
configuration around.

Change-Id: I337f9fefe7f0364bce3a0192dfc9c1199076fa02
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Configure 'python-requires'

This will prevent setuptools accidentally installing os-traits in a
Python 2 environment.

Change-Id: I4ecd197cfedca74bc8a068edc08c2bc097f41458
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Do not mask services on db departed
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-02-25 18:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-02-27 15:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 18:28:09.000000000', 'message': 'Do not mask services on db departed

Currently the charm masks all services on db departed. The consequence
of which is that when a db relation is re-joined these services are not
started back up.

In addition, it stops all services, including memcached and haproxy,
which also do not get restarted on a db re-join.

This change selectively stops but does not mask services that pertain
directly to nova. So that on db joined the correct services get started.

Change-Id: I81f59c97b33edd5c3e67c379cfdee8f26509075a
'}]
commit_message:
Do not mask services on db departed

Currently the charm masks all services on db departed. The consequence
of which is that when a db relation is re-joined these services are not
started back up.

In addition, it stops all services, including memcached and haproxy,
which also do not get restarted on a db re-join.

This change selectively stops but does not mask services that pertain
directly to nova. So that on db joined the correct services get started.

Change-Id: I81f59c97b33edd5c3e67c379cfdee8f26509075a

commit_message:
Release mox3 1.0.0

This version officially drop the python 2 support so we release a major
version of mox3 to inform user that we break
the backward compatibility.

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I097c1f710dc6fbf5b019f36240eae6983589ff3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-26 19:34:38.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

neutron-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Rocky jobs are modified to run on py2 on stable/rocky gate
and on py3 for master gate. Rest all jobs are fine to run on
py3 except queens (which run on py2 because those do not run on master gate.)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

neutron-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705184/

Change-Id: I9daafef0847a9a9baa45382b87da71fe8d1fffd0

[CEPH] Enable messenger version2 protocol from values

This is to enable messenger v2 only when user would like to enable it from  values.

commit_message:
[ceph-mon] update liveness probe to wait for ceph-mon fully up

This is to update liveness probe script to wait for mon to comeup fully
since ceph-mon could wait foroever for quorum to form in
probing or electing states.

Change-Id: I11de42cccbb44f47fd8704cc5d00dc4c19c756e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 17:12:38.000000000', 'message': "hiera-steps-tasks: new task to compute Puppet config hash

This task will generate /var/lib/config_data/puppet_config.md5sum file
which is a combined hash of directories that can affect Puppet configurations.
If the hash is different from a previous run, it would trigger new
configurations (e.g. new puppet module, new hieradata).
If a previous md5sum was deployed, it'll be moved to .previous_run so later
we can compare if it changed.
The files are used by container_puppet_config module to figure out what
container need to be re-configured, so we save time during minor updates
or scale operations.

Change-Id: Id959164bffa255e9d2ab0f2ad61db9b741c9c224
"}, {'created': '2020-02-25 19:49:36.000000000', 'message': "hiera-steps-tasks: new task to compute Puppet config hash

'}, {'created': '2020-02-26 22:26:41.000000000', 'message': 'hiera-steps-tasks: new task to compute Puppet config hash

commit_message:
hiera-steps-tasks: new task to compute Puppet config hash

This task will generate /var/lib/config_data/puppet_config.md5sum file
which is a combined hash of directories that can affect Puppet configurations.
The files are used by tripleo_container_manage role to figure out what
puppet container need to be re-run, so we save time during minor updates
or scale operations.

Then we create a fact, tripleo_puppet_config_hash, used later when
calling the tripleo_container_manage role.

Change-Id: Id959164bffa255e9d2ab0f2ad61db9b741c9c224

It's been reported that we still failing too quickly for some
environments with a mix of vms and physical hardware. Let's increase the
default ssh port timeout to 600 seconds to work around this.

commit_message:
Increase ssh port timeout

It's been reported that we still failing too quickly for some
environments with a mix of vms and physical hardware. Let's increase the
default ssh port timeout to 600 seconds to work around this.

See also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1805429
Related-Bug: #1805725

Change-Id: I95ddc0b7cb6342c367772b0cf296ee372dbb92dd

commit_message:
Expose apt repo configuration

Currently one can not override the apt repository used for ELK stack
package installation due to variable precedence as the repo info is
defined in vars rather than defaults. To be able to do so is
particularly useful in the case that on wishes to specify alternative
mirrors to use. This commit optionally exposes the remote apt
configuration in the elastic_repoitory role defaults so that the user
can modify it in order to redirect to a mirror. The default
configuration is unchanged.

Change-Id: I6459bd8b1b55253a869b018d187c7ec29957a3c1

subject: Exposed heartbeat monitor list
messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-02-24 16:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-02-24 17:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2020-02-27 13:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 16:48:10.000000000', 'message': "Exposed heartbeat monitor list

Currently heartbeat will be configured to ping every host in the
inventory on its 'ansible_host' interface when deployed. This commit
allows this host list to be overridden using the heartbeat_icmp_hosts
variable to avoid e.g. monitoring connections between different
networks. The default monitor list has also been changed from 'all' to
the heartbeat deployment hosts.

Change-Id: Icb3688e4a2f87ac29df142973f21b96b2686f935
"}]
commit_message:
Exposed heartbeat monitor list

Currently heartbeat will be configured to ping every host in the
inventory on its 'ansible_host' interface when deployed. This commit
allows this host list to be overridden using the heartbeat_icmp_hosts
variable to avoid e.g. monitoring connections between different
networks. The default monitor list has also been changed from 'all' to
the heartbeat deployment hosts.

Change-Id: Icb3688e4a2f87ac29df142973f21b96b2686f935

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 16:48:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove duplication in Heartbeat config

Currently much of the template in the template heartbeat config file is
duplicated, presumably due to a copy and paste error. This commit
removes the duplicate definition of variables in the template file.

Change-Id: I5786a5a94b56d0ada33ab9607a06548b2678d7f7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplication in Heartbeat config

Currently much of the template in the template heartbeat config file is
duplicated, presumably due to a copy and paste error. This commit
removes the duplicate definition of variables in the template file.

Change-Id: I5786a5a94b56d0ada33ab9607a06548b2678d7f7

Resolves the following warnings seen in the likes of Neutron:

  opt/stack/neutron/neutron/common/eventlet_utils.py:28:

  function in your custom Eventlet hub <module 'oslo_service'

  It must return bool: whether hub supports current platform. See

attribute.

commit_message:
Add 'is_available' function

Resolves the following warnings seen in the likes of Neutron:

  opt/stack/neutron/neutron/common/eventlet_utils.py:28:
  DeprecationWarning: Please provide `is_available()`
  function in your custom Eventlet hub <module 'oslo_service'

  It must return bool: whether hub supports current platform. See
  eventlet/hubs/{epoll,kqueue} for example.

Since we're simply taking the default hub provided by eventlet and
overriding a single attribute, we will always have support so set the
attribute.

Change-Id: Ie90bcce1d1724108e5d0e583a36aa2e20102bba4

commit_message:
Release Ceilometer stable branches

This patch proposes releases for the following stable branches:

Rocky 11.1.0
Stein 12.1.0
Train 13.1.0

We bump the minor version for all branches since some commits declare
new resource types for Gnocchi, which could be interpreted as new
features.

Change-Id: I6b128ff0d22ce13e1245a4c55ce608142564207d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-20 07:21:46.000000000', 'message': "Image upload fails if cinder multipath is enabled

Image upload is failing with NoFibreChannelVolumeDeviceFound error after
configuring cinder backend (HP3Par FC storage) for the glance service. The
issue here is that usually cinder calls os_brick with multipath information
but in this case cinder driver of glance is doing the call (without passing
any multipath information). with hard-coded' False to let os_brick library
know that multipath is not configured.

In order to fix this, added two new boolean config option for cinder
driver default to False;

'cinder_use_multipath'
'cinder_enforce_multipath'

Change-Id: I07064f3cb1a33ac4ac7e4b572f8e1b5c688bd9a3
Closes-Bug: #1863983
"}, {'created': '2020-02-20 07:28:03.000000000', 'message': "Image upload fails if cinder multipath is enabled

Image upload is failing with NoFibreChannelVolumeDeviceFound error after
configuring cinder backend (HP3Par FC storage) for the glance service. The
issue here is that usually cinder calls os_brick with multipath information
but in this case cinder driver of glance is doing the call (without passing
any multipath information). with hard-coded' False to let os_brick library
know that multipath is not configured.

In order to fix this, added two new boolean config option for cinder
driver default to False;

'cinder_use_multipath'
'cinder_enforce_multipath'

Change-Id: I07064f3cb1a33ac4ac7e4b572f8e1b5c688bd9a3
Closes-Bug: #1863983

commit_message:
Image upload fails if cinder multipath is enabled

Image upload is failing with NoFibreChannelVolumeDeviceFound error after
configuring cinder backend (HP3Par FC storage) for the glance service. The
issue here is that usually cinder calls os_brick with multipath information
but in this case cinder driver of glance is doing the call (without passing
any multipath information). with hard-coded' False to let os_brick library
know that multipath is not configured.

In order to fix this, added two new boolean config option for cinder
driver default to False;

'cinder_use_multipath'
'cinder_enforce_multipath'

Change-Id: I07064f3cb1a33ac4ac7e4b572f8e1b5c688bd9a3
Closes-Bug: #1863983

commit_message:
Don't fail if VIP already exist or has been deleted before

Sometimes there is a race condition on creation of VIP port
or deleting it that ends with exception and blocks LB stack
creation / deletion.

Because for now we don't have running master branch
for OVN provider driver this change will be applied
first on stable/train in networking-ovn tree and then cherry-picked.

Change-Id: I2aaae7c407caba7a57e2ca2d4ed524f3bb63953f
Closes-Bug: #1860141

[{'created': '2020-02-19 09:08:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for multiple L4 protocols withing same LB

This change introduces a way of providing multiple listeners and pools
on the same Load Balancer, but with different L4 protocols.

In case there are more than one unique protocol defined in Octavia pools
or Octavia listeners the OVN driver now adds another Load_Balancer row
per protocol, but with the same name. The selection of which OVN
Load_Balancer should be used is done by a protocol key.

This change also adds possibility to expose two listeners on the same
port, but with different L4 protocol. The common use-case is providing
a DNS service that listens both on UDP and TCP sockets.

Partial-Bug: #1789157

commit_message:
Add support for multiple L4 protocols withing same LB

This change introduces a way of providing multiple listeners and pools
on the same Load Balancer, but with different L4 protocols.

In case there are more than one unique protocol defined in Octavia pools
or Octavia listeners the OVN driver now adds another Load_Balancer row
per protocol, but with the same name. The selection of which OVN
Load_Balancer should be used is done by a protocol key.

This change also adds possibility to expose two listeners on the same
port, but with different L4 protocol. The common use-case is providing
a DNS service that listens both on UDP and TCP sockets.

Partial-Bug: #1789157
Change-Id: I2ee13b75713e7538d1b4f70207a90a95315eb914

commit_message:
Ignore Not Found when deleting Keystone role assignment

If the project has already been deleted, don't let that prevent role
assignments on it from being deleted.

Change-Id: I56aede8209e425ee6c2d762a44db8cda5416e69b
Task: 30955

[{'created': '2020-02-19 09:22:57.000000000', 'message': "Don't send malformed status update to Octavia

Provider Driver sends a malformed status update
to Octavia that breaks the update operation and

In OVN while resource is administratively disabled
we suffix its ID with string ':D'.
This patch filters this string from resources ID
before sending Octavia a status update.

Because for now we don't have running master branch
for OVN provider driver this change will be applied

commit_message:
Don't send malformed status update to Octavia

In some corner cases while updating a member, OVN
Provider Driver sends a malformed status update
to Octavia that breaks the update operation and
resources stuck in PENDING_UPDATE state.

In OVN while resource is administratively disabled
we suffix its ID with string ':D'.
This patch filters this string from resources ID
before sending Octavia a status update.

Because for now we don't have running master branch
for OVN provider driver this change will be applied
first on stable/train and then cherry-picked.

Change-Id: Ib2ce04625faddd6ed263678bad2f4eb10929a520
Closes-Bug: #1860140

[{'created': '2020-02-19 09:22:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix py2 vs py3 dict keys comparison in functional test

In just added functional test there is a bug in dict
keys comparison. In python2 the dict keys are dumped to list that
is unordered. This makes random gate failures.

In py3 its dumped into dict_keys object that doesn't need
to be sorted.

In py3 its dumped into dict_keys object that doesn't need
to be sorted.

Change-Id: I3aa7927b2eb0e9dd34935107835aa677fbcd1924
"}]
commit_message:
Fix py2 vs py3 dict keys comparison in functional test

In just added functional test there is a bug in dict
keys comparison. In python2 the dict keys are dumped to list that
is unordered. This makes random gate failures.

In py3 its dumped into dict_keys object that doesn't need
to be sorted.

Change-Id: I3aa7927b2eb0e9dd34935107835aa677fbcd1924

subject: Cache OvnProviderHelper object in OvnProviderDriver
messages: [{'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-19 09:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-20 15:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-24 08:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-24 14:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-02-24 21:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 09:22:57.000000000', 'message': "Cache OvnProviderHelper object in OvnProviderDriver

Every time when a request comes from Octavia API and
is passed down to provider driver Octavia creates new
instance of Provider driver. This is good approach
while an API layer don't want to wait for previous API
actions to be end first, if centralized driver approach
will be used.

On different angle we have OvnProviderDriver and its
architecutre that was not created to work in dynamic
threads environment, but has centralized design.
Actual architecture looks like:

OvnProviderDriver object starts OvnPrividerHelper object
that manipulates OVN Databases. In OvnProviderHelper there is
a Queue.Queue object that stores actions to be executed
on databases with proper order. In addition OvnProviderHelper
starts dedicated thread that picks up actions from Queue
and execute those on OVN NorthBound database.

That solution does not scale while using it with Octavia
approach. There is a problem with thread leaking, because
in OvnProviderHelper we don't stop runner thread and we thread
it as daemon.

In addition on each API call the OVN Driver and dependent
components objects are created, this is big overhead.

To mitigate those architectural issues there is a possibility
to cache created OVNProviderHelper object and use one
instance of it for one Octavia API worker process.

This change must be cherry-picked to stable branches.

As next steps OVNProvider driver should be decomposed to:
   * Provider Agent as described in [1]
   * Provider Driver without Queue mechanism

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/contributor/guides/providers.html#provider-agents

Change-Id: Ifaed77bbe6c36a63c18e568ec1d6ec5450dc8e03
Closes-Bug: 1856550

commit_message:
Cache OvnProviderHelper object in OvnProviderDriver

Every time when a request comes from Octavia API and
is passed down to provider driver Octavia creates new
instance of Provider driver. This is good approach
while an API layer don't want to wait for previous API
actions to be end first, if centralized driver approach
will be used.

On different angle we have OvnProviderDriver and its
architecutre that was not created to work in dynamic
threads environment, but has centralized design.
Actual architecture looks like:

OvnProviderDriver object starts OvnPrividerHelper object
that manipulates OVN Databases. In OvnProviderHelper there is
a Queue.Queue object that stores actions to be executed
on databases with proper order. In addition OvnProviderHelper
starts dedicated thread that picks up actions from Queue
and execute those on OVN NorthBound database.

That solution does not scale while using it with Octavia
approach. There is a problem with thread leaking, because
in OvnProviderHelper we don't stop runner thread and we thread
it as daemon.

In addition on each API call the OVN Driver and dependent
components objects are created, this is big overhead.

To mitigate those architectural issues there is a possibility
to cache created OVNProviderHelper object and use one
instance of it for one Octavia API worker process.

This change must be cherry-picked to stable branches.

As next steps OVNProvider driver should be decomposed to:
   * Provider Agent as described in [1]
   * Provider Driver without Queue mechanism

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/contributor/guides/providers.html#provider-agents

Change-Id: Ifaed77bbe6c36a63c18e568ec1d6ec5450dc8e03
Closes-Bug: 1856550

subject: Don't fail in case subnet or Logical Switch not found
messages: [{'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-19 09:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-20 15:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-24 08:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-02-24 14:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-02-24 22:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:34:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 09:21:13.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail in case subnet or Logical Switch not found

In case of subnet not found all the related actions could
not be taken. This patch prevent this situation to happen.
This could be possible that LB is going to be deleted after
the subnet (for example remove of the LoadBalancer in Error
state).

The same could happend with Logical Switch. Sometimes the
member network is delated in meantime and then we tries to
the members. It means we would need to remove LB to LS and
LB to LR associations, but it could not happend because of
missing LS. In those terms now we just pass the flow
and remove the LS to LR counters in external_ids.

Change-Id: I44f6de4c9a2b1c6054417dbb7f647a6af8339660
Closes-Bug: 1857009
(cherry picked from networking-ovn 9aa7edd7852df98fe257d6a3b5c3b524398a1d4b)
"}, {'created': '2020-02-20 15:47:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail in case subnet or Logical Switch not found

commit_message:
Don't fail in case subnet or Logical Switch not found

In case of subnet not found all the related actions could
not be taken. This patch prevent this situation to happen.
This could be possible that LB is going to be deleted after
the subnet (for example remove of the LoadBalancer in Error
state).

The same could happend with Logical Switch. Sometimes the
member network is delated in meantime and then we tries to
the members. It means we would need to remove LB to LS and
LB to LR associations, but it could not happend because of
missing LS. In those terms now we just pass the flow
and remove the LS to LR counters in external_ids.

Change-Id: I44f6de4c9a2b1c6054417dbb7f647a6af8339660
Closes-Bug: 1857009
(cherry picked from networking-ovn 9aa7edd7852df98fe257d6a3b5c3b524398a1d4b)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Import OVN LB functional tests

This patch imports OVN LB functional tests.

Unfortunately neutron hasn't been released yet
so for test requirements we need to install it
from git, from commit that imports functional
base class to neutron [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701733/


Change-Id: Ia65492db1688f3a3fce22a4432ae8445f67c37b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 16:16:34.000000000', 'message': "Add publish job for stackviz

stackviz gets published daily to:
https://tarballs.opendev.org/openstack/stackviz/dist/stackviz-latest.tar.gz

The current job periodic-package-stackviz-element is a legacy job,
create a new job publish-openstack-javascript-latest-content that can be
run instead.

The stackviz-element is backed into our images and thus we have to be
extra careful not to break it and test.

The new job is publishing temporarily under a different filename to
check that it's working correctly.

Order of changes:
* Merge this change, so we run both periodic-package-stackviz-element and
  publish-openstack-javascript-latest-content in stackviz.
* Change new job to publish under correct name and remove setup in
  project-config.
* Switch to new job in stackviz repo.

Change-Id: I81ac0975f03756da673ae12e7e11cd5686a0f2d6

commit_message:
Add publish job for stackviz

stackviz gets published daily to:
https://tarballs.opendev.org/openstack/stackviz/dist/stackviz-latest.tar.gz

The current job periodic-package-stackviz-element is a legacy job,
create a new job publish-openstack-javascript-latest-content that can be
run instead.

The stackviz-element is backed into our images and thus we have to be
extra careful not to break it and test.

The new job is publishing temporarily under a different filename to
check that it's working correctly.

Order of changes:
* Merge this change, so we run both periodic-package-stackviz-element and
  publish-openstack-javascript-latest-content in stackviz.
* Change new job to publish under correct name and remove setup in
  project-config.
* Switch to new job in stackviz repo.

Change-Id: I81ac0975f03756da673ae12e7e11cd5686a0f2d6

commit_message:
Fix default value of Base and Target release and dir

BASE_RELEASE and TARGET_RELEASE var are used for respective dir and
correct value for them is 'old' and 'new' which are nothing but the
dire for base and target devstack.

Also correct the default valeu for BASE_DEVSTACK_BRANCH which will be
updated on every cycle.

Change-Id: Ia2b50f3e48921f81fe12cd94347e1363b29681ea

commit_message:
Manual run of generate-constraints

had to run manually to fix the python3 cap on gitdb

hold back docutils because boto likes to cap things
hold back msgpack because salt likes to cap things
hold back alembic because it breaks nova tests
  - review.opendev.org/708707

Change-Id: I398c0aee001f4e6a8e7fc89597738b356b885437
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Remove releasenotes directory

In cyborg-specs we are not necessary to maintain the release notes,
most of the time, release notes are added when features are
added/removed or major changes (e.g. bug fix) are made to help
developers know the development process.

Change-Id: I220741519966b6cf048d136602f8028707c73103

commit_message:
Fixes gnocchi-api script name for Ubuntu/Debian

The old script name was 'python3-gnocchi-api'. It should be
'gnocchi-api' anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1861688

Change-Id: I78fb248859b43dc1636133dadc036028388ab564

commit_message:
Switch to sphinx-build and cleanup

1.Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2
  since sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

2. Switch to using modern sphinx-build.
3. Remove oslotest, testtools packages from test-requirements.txt,
   their not used.

Change-Id: Ia25e4a06ca2ec4e0018d5763e0946ded704b521b

commit_message:
Fix some flake8 warnings

fix and enable:
- E121 continuation line under-indented for hanging indent
- E126 continuation line over-indented for hanging indent
- E226 missing whitespace around arithmetic operator
- H306  imports not in alphabetical order
- H401  docstring should not start with a space

Change-Id: I1dab6908652924931e750187380d153d64eba2b6

subject: Fix `kayobe control host bootstrap` on CentOS 8
messages:
[{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-01-17 12:04:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-01-17 12:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-01-17 12:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Importing selinux from the kolla-ansible venv fails:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/centos/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selinux/__init__.py", line 14, in swig_import_helper
    return importlib.import_module(mname)
  File "/home/centos/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib64/python3.6/importlib/__init__.py", line 126, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 994, in _gcd_import
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 971, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 953, in _find_and_load_unlocked
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named '_selinux'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/centos/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selinux/__init__.py", line 17, in <module>
    _selinux = swig_import_helper()
  File "/home/centos/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selinux/__init__.py", line 16, in swig_import_helper
    return importlib.import_module('_selinux')
  File "/home/centos/venvs/kolla-ansible/lib64/python3.6/importlib/__init__.py", line 126, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named '_selinux''}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-01-17 14:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-01-17 19:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-14 17:19:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Holding off on this for now. I think using ansible_python is the right approach, but we can't use it yet since:

* we need to switch to kolla-ansible master branch
* kolla-ansible master doesn't support py3
* kayobe doesn't support py3

So for now we need to use py2 for kayobe and py3 for kolla ansible. I'm using that approach in https://review.opendev.org/705000 and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701747."}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-02-27 05:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fixed differently by Mark.'}]

commit_message:
Fix `kayobe control host bootstrap` on CentOS 8

We adapt tasks to use the right python sitearch directory, based on
major and minor Python version. On CentOS 8, a _selinux.*.so shared
library must be linked into the virtualenv for selinux imports to work.

Change-Id: Ifd9c13ddb54f08e91a2d85137bfe4834459f7856
Story: 2006574
Task: 36683

commit_message:
update build-test-packages for centos-8

* based on the ansible_distro and version
set the appropriate build target and
dlrn server.

* set type to -local where appropriate

Change-Id: I74ce4f9ab46de4301309ae6b6fdee54a5ed869a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-27 17:43:17.000000000', 'message': "Add support for glance multistore

Add parameters to support deploying multiple glance-api backends. The
existing GlanceBackend parameter specifies the first backend, and it's
the default backend when multiple backends are defined. Additional backends
are defined using a new GlanceMultistoreConfig parameter. The data is
a hash where the keys are the glance backend identifier and the data is
the glance settings for that backend. A new GlanceStoreDescription lets
the user to provide a description for each backend.

The configuration can specify any combination of supported backend types.
Multiple rbd backends can be specified, but cinder, file and swift
backends are limited to one each.

Change-Id: Ifc538250815f0ce0e534cae443037e143309ca56
Depends-On: I41ab9b3593bf3d078c5bbd1826df8308e3f5e7af

commit_message:
Add support for glance multistore

Add parameters to support deploying multiple glance-api backends. The
existing GlanceBackend parameter specifies the first backend, and it's
the default backend when multiple backends are defined. Additional backends
are defined using a new GlanceMultistoreConfig parameter. The data is
a hash where the keys are the glance backend identifier and the data is
the glance settings for that backend. A new GlanceStoreDescription lets
the user to provide a description for each backend.

The configuration can specify any combination of supported backend types.
Multiple rbd backends can be specified, but cinder, file and swift
backends are limited to one each.

Change-Id: Ifc538250815f0ce0e534cae443037e143309ca56
Depends-On: I41ab9b3593bf3d078c5bbd1826df8308e3f5e7af

[{'created': '2019-06-15 16:11:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add VLAN type conntrack direct flow

For vlan type network, we add a segment match flow
to the openflow security group ingress table. Then
the packets will be recorded in conntrack table, and
the reply packets can be processed properly.

commit_message:
Add VLAN type conntrack direct flow

For vlan type network, we add a segment match flow
to the openflow security group ingress table. Then
the packets will be recorded in conntrack table, and
the reply packets can be processed properly.

Change-Id: Ieded0654d0ad16235ec923b822dcd842bd7735e5
Closes-Bug: #1831534

commit_message:
Added OctaviaDeploymentConfig to deployed server role

The Octavia ansible deployment tasks are missing from deployed server
role. This is only relevant for stein and older branches.

Change-Id: I671b770304345d780de4720b5693c1b9991f1ef8
Closes-Bug: #1864915

commit_message:
Update Fedora image ref for test jobs

Fedora-Cloud-Base-29-1.2.x86_64 is removed from openstack local mirror.
Update to use Fedora-Cloud-Base-30-1.2.x86_64 for test jobs.

Change-Id: I37ddde75cf0e9422191aabac3df42c555f1a5c6c

commit_message:
Migrate the openstack overcloud delete command to use Ansible

The overcloud delete command will now use the ansible playbook found
within the tripleo-ansible project to process the stack delete workflow.

story: 2007212
task: 2007212
Depends-On: Ic0bd173ad34d1c01a58a66d9a754acd3093a972c
Change-Id: I9f461803ecf3abdf46c0b2b629e6e6708f3160cb

commit_message:
WIP Modify roles to remove unused services

Historically we've included unused services in all the roles as a way
for users to enable the services for a given role. By default many are
set to OS::Heat::None. For large scale deployments this results in many
extra resources managed by heat.

This change adds a function to look at the resource registry of the
environment and will remove any unused services from the roles data.
Removing these services from the roles data reduces number of heat
resource and hence possibly little deployment time.

Change-Id: If2d61c6dd4c9dcf4b1c784a5cf83ef70a6fda315

update centos8 build containers to current-tripleo build

was the only build avail.  We are now pinning new
builds w/ tripleo-ci-testing for the integration jobs.
Must protect CHECK :)

commit_message:
[k8s] Make metrics-server work without DNS

At present, metrics-server pod keeps doing a CrashLoopBack because host
name does not resolve when a cloud does not operate a DNS.

Task: 38642
Story: 2007265

Change-Id: Ia47a9282f56f30569b190ec2585b38c459086b63
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>
(cherry picked from commit 8108679c2dc5018c3beb66ae2cd04e94984c25dd)

subject: Fix api-cert-manager=true blocking cluster creation
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-02-26 09:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-02-27 00:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 16:29:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix api-cert-manager=true blocking cluster creation

In the current release, cert-api-manager runs on kubecluster.yaml [1],
but in the kubemaster.yaml [2] the script [3] expects the existance of
the ca.key file (if the cert_api_manager_enabled=true), otherwise it gets blocked.
This file (ca.key), in turn, it's created only when enable-cert-api-manager.sh runs [4]

So, we have a dead lock...
So we need to change the call enable-cert-api-manager.sh into the kubemaster.yaml

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml#L1158-L1161
[2] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml#L760
[3] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-services-master.sh#L12-L16
[4] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-cert-api-manager.sh#L11

On other issue, the chown of this file (ca.key) it's not working. Moving the
call of this file into kubemaster.yaml makes cluster creation FAILS because of
an error [7] in [5]. If we check a cluster created in stein [6] we notice that
the file is owned by root:root. Knowing this we can comment [5] for now.

[5] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-cert-api-manager.sh#L13
[6] http://paste.openstack.org/show/788534/
[7] http://paste.openstack.org/show/788537/

Change-Id: Ibee2df435c3f7c34bff74e9146fb28d8367124b1
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 1ecec95b8cea1001fa762f09ed3fa40fbb1b4bd8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix api-cert-manager=true blocking cluster creation

In the current release, cert-api-manager runs on kubecluster.yaml [1],
but in the kubemaster.yaml [2] the script [3] expects the existance of
the ca.key file (if the cert_api_manager_enabled=true), otherwise it gets blocked.
This file (ca.key), in turn, it's created only when enable-cert-api-manager.sh runs [4]

So, we have a dead lock...
So we need to change the call enable-cert-api-manager.sh into the kubemaster.yaml

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml#L1158-L1161
[2] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml#L760
[3] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-services-master.sh#L12-L16
[4] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-cert-api-manager.sh#L11

On other issue, the chown of this file (ca.key) it's not working. Moving the
call of this file into kubemaster.yaml makes cluster creation FAILS because of
an error [7] in [5]. If we check a cluster created in stein [6] we notice that
the file is owned by root:root. Knowing this we can comment [5] for now.

[5] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-cert-api-manager.sh#L13
[6] http://paste.openstack.org/show/788534/
[7] http://paste.openstack.org/show/788537/

Change-Id: Ibee2df435c3f7c34bff74e9146fb28d8367124b1
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 1ecec95b8cea1001fa762f09ed3fa40fbb1b4bd8)

commit_message:
[bug] Fix regression when use_podman=false

A regression was introduced by I970c1b91254d2a375192420a9169f3a629c56ce7
which means that deployments where use_podman is unspecified or false
fail because `podman image inspect` is not scoped by this check.

Story: 2007001
Task: 38844

Change-Id: I6a08312693caf8a52174a1ff199d205d54076ee9
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>
(cherry picked from commit 95abb45dca9d7da3530839e4cf63be4249bc1525)

  tested manually.

commit_message:
Add base centos 8 jobs for parenting

Looking forward, the centos 8 jobs will diverge
from the centos 7 pattern. As such, this review adds new
abstract jobs for centos 8 so that the centos 8
jobs can be modifed w/o changing the centos 7
and possible, RHEL 8 patterns.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/1436
Change-Id: I8aa383d64d68843163960d03087f2e956e9c1027

commit_message:
Adding IPoIB child interfaces to the os-net-config

This patch adds support for implementing IPoIB child interfaces using
the os-net-config. It allows the user to create persistent IB childs
using ifcfg implementation. It adds the type ib_child_interface to the
os-net-config interfaces which needs the parent interface and the pkey
id as required fields. The IPoIB child interface should be a seperate
interface from the parent interface.

Change-Id: I9ae739c892318c28ad6165a96644719fa1aa693d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-25 17:32:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add setfacl statements for neutron metadata proxy

Statements to setfacl on fast forward upgrade were added for the l3
agent container and the neutron dhcp container.  But they are missing
from the metadata proxy container, which can lead to this sort of thing

messages:
[{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-09-18 17:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-09-18 17:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

this doesn't work yet, I didn't even mean to push it up"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-02-27 00:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Done in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/ and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673682/ instead.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 17:27:23.000000000', 'message': 's3api: Implement object versioning API

Set up versioning for a container and return the status of versioning.

When deleting buckets, also try to delete the +versioning bucket.

Store version id when copying object to archive

When the current object is deleted and the versioning mode is set to
"stack", an older object from the archive container is restored as the
current object.  The "version id" is only part of the object name when
it is in the archive container, which means that when it becomes the
current object, the "version id" is lost.  swift3 needs to know the
version id even after it is restored, but right now there is no way to
get the version id.

This change stores the version id as metadata
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Version-Id" when an object is copied to the archive
container and given a version id.

s3api: Modify obj GETorHEAD to support versions

If a versionId is given, if it is "null", it must be the current object.
If the versionId is not null, it might be in the versioning container,
or it might be the current object that had that version id that was
restored after an object has been deleted.

s3api: Listing of versioned objects

When processing GET requests for buckets with "?versions", in addition
to listing what is currently in the bucket, also return the objects that
are in the versioning container.

Add X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override

swift3 needs both the stack mode delete and history mode delete.  When
an object without specifying a "versionId" is deleted, swift3 uses the
history mode delete, which means the object is marked as deleted and
returns 404.  When an object with a specific "versionId" is deleted and
that object is the current object, swift3 uses the stack mode delete,
which means the most recent non-deleted object in the versioning
container becomes the current object.  Right now, swift only supports
setting the mode once and using it to determine the behavior of the
deletion.

Adding X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override allows swift3 to override the
stored versioning mode for one request.  This means that even if the
versioning mode is set to "history", if the request has the header
"X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override: stack", swift will use "stack" as
the versioning mode.

s3api: Delete versioned objects

When deleting an object with a specified version, and it is in the
versioning container, it is deleted permanently.  If it is the current
version, then the object is deleted and the next available object in the
versioning container becomes the current object.

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

wip: moar s3api versions tests

Change-Id: Id8af40397dea57abe0abca17ae90af2e83fc1bea
'}]
commit_message:
s3api: Implement object versioning API

Set up versioning for a container and return the status of versioning.

When deleting buckets, also try to delete the +versioning bucket.

Store version id when copying object to archive

When the current object is deleted and the versioning mode is set to
"stack", an older object from the archive container is restored as the
current object.  The "version id" is only part of the object name when
it is in the archive container, which means that when it becomes the
current object, the "version id" is lost.  swift3 needs to know the
version id even after it is restored, but right now there is no way to
get the version id.

This change stores the version id as metadata
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Version-Id" when an object is copied to the archive
container and given a version id.

s3api: Modify obj GETorHEAD to support versions

If a versionId is given, if it is "null", it must be the current object.
If the versionId is not null, it might be in the versioning container,
or it might be the current object that had that version id that was
restored after an object has been deleted.

s3api: Listing of versioned objects

When processing GET requests for buckets with "?versions", in addition
to listing what is currently in the bucket, also return the objects that
are in the versioning container.

Add X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override

swift3 needs both the stack mode delete and history mode delete.  When
an object without specifying a "versionId" is deleted, swift3 uses the
history mode delete, which means the object is marked as deleted and
returns 404.  When an object with a specific "versionId" is deleted and
that object is the current object, swift3 uses the stack mode delete,
which means the most recent non-deleted object in the versioning
container becomes the current object.  Right now, swift only supports
setting the mode once and using it to determine the behavior of the
deletion.

Adding X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override allows swift3 to override the
stored versioning mode for one request.  This means that even if the
versioning mode is set to "history", if the request has the header
"X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override: stack", swift will use "stack" as
the versioning mode.

s3api: Delete versioned objects

When deleting an object with a specified version, and it is in the
versioning container, it is deleted permanently.  If it is the current
version, then the object is deleted and the next available object in the
versioning container becomes the current object.

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

wip: moar s3api versions tests

Change-Id: Id8af40397dea57abe0abca17ae90af2e83fc1bea

commit_message:
Doc cleanup, use openstackdocstheme

Switch to "modern" way of docs building in OpenStack:
* Use sphinx-build
* Use openstackdocstheme instead of old oslosphinx
* Adjust settings for openstackdocstheme
* Fix build errors:
  - There's no priorities folder in this repo,
    so remove non-existing links.
  - There's no backlog file, remove link.
  - remove links in specs that don't exist
  - fix RST link formatting
  - Fix RST errors

Change-Id: I0d1d1c866957e7dbd5d4e394b0368a0a5250b00b

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602622/7
